title: Speculoos Cookie Butter Beer
description: Every now and then, we introduce a product that, from the moment it’s released, reaches a kind of instantaneously iconic status. Our Speculoos Cookie Butter certainly fits that bill. The moment this superlatively soft, sweet spread hit our grocery shelves, our customers couldn’t get enough. We heard tell of folks mixing it into brownie batter, blending it in coffee drinks, drizzling it over a sundae… This got us thinking: if cookie butter goes well with all those desserts, we bet it would taste great as a dessertbeer, too. Lo and behold, that bet has paid off, in the form of our Speculoos Cookie Butter Beer,It’s made in collaboration with one of our favorite craft breweries (and an award-winning producer of delicious dessert beers), Hardywood Park. For this impressive imperial golden ale, they use vanilla beans, milk sugar, and toasted coconut to evoke the sweet, caramel-y flavor of Cookie Butter in every rich, flavorful sip. It’s excellent as both an after-dinner indulgence, and when enjoyed on a long, lazy, late-summer weekend afternoon; we’re partial to pairing our Cookie Butter Beer with cheesecake, toasted Banana Bread, or baked Brie with berries.

title: Motif Cabernet Sauvignon Red Hills Lake County
description: Travel north from Napa Valley an hour or two and you’ll discover Clear Lake, the largest natural lake found wholly within California. There, in Lake County, you’ll also discover one of the fastest growing wine regions in the state—and the provenance of Motif Cabernet Sauvignon.Motif is made with 80% Cabernet Sauvignon grapes, 10% Malbec, and 10% Petit Verdot, all grown in the Red Hills of Lake County. The mild climate combines with mineral-rich volcanic soil to produce this elegant and complex red. A soft palate and silky tannins convey notes of blueberry amid a sweet, earthy background. This deep, dark-purple wine displays aromas of sweet fruits, dark cherry, and blackberries, with hints of licorice and graphite leading to a velvety finish.

title: Grand Reserve Syrah Sonoma County 2022
description: Ah, Syrah. This fabulously full-bodied, dependably delicious grape forms the backbone of many a rich red wine, due in large part to its remarkable adaptability: Syrahs from warmer environs tend to be bigger and bolder, while those grown in more moderate conditions are almost always softer and gentler. Carefully crafted with grapes in California’s Sonoma County, Trader Joe’s Grand Reserve Syrah Lot 133 is a bit of both, thanks to Sonoma’s bright, sunny days and long, cool nights. With its medium-to-full body, fine tannins, and juicy, peppery profile, it might just be the ideal red wine for the end of summer.Lush, fruity, and complex, with decidedly smooth edges, this Grand Reserve Syrah makes an especially apt accompaniment to a smoky, barbecued brisket, grilled veggies, or a juicy Angus Burger with all your favorite fixings. As you sip it, be sure to let all its flavors sink in: our tasting panel found notes of candied blueberries, white pepper, and even a bit of beef jerky.

title: Reserve Chardonnay Yountville Napa Valley 2023
description: Crafted for us with care by an expert winemaker within Napa Valley’s Yountville A.V.A. (American Viticultural Area), our latest Trader Joe’s Reserve Chardonnay is the very definition of a fine wine. After the grapes are picked, crushed, and macerated, the juice is aged in both new oak and once-used French oak barrels for eight months. In your glass, this Chardonnay opens with enticing aromas of ripe pear and honeydew, leading to a palate that unveils an ideal balance between crisp green apple and hints of toasted vanilla. Refreshing acidity and subtle oak nuances culminate in a creamy, lingering finish that is ultimately a delightful expression of Yountville’s esteemed terroir.Creamy chicken dishes are a classic pairing with Chardonnay, and our Organic Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts lend themselves beautifully to Poulet à la Crème or Chicken Fricassée—if you’re in the cheffing mood. Go lighter (both calorie & work-wise) with either a ready-to-eat Caesar Salad with Salmon or Chicken, from our refrigerators. And if the weather’s fine, and you’re up for a more casual experience, Trader Joe’s Unexpected Cheddar Chicken Sausages are fantastic on the grill, and a nice complement to this Napa white.

title: Yellow Squash
description: “Thin-skinned” isn’t generally seen as a sought-after quality—unless you’re talking about Yellow Squash. This veggie is currently at peak-season perfection, so why not take advantage of its abundance and add it to your shopping list? Its aforementioned thin skin makes Yellow Squash ideal for slicing into ribbons and tossing with lemon juice, halved cherry tomatoes, and a few spoonfuls of TJ’s Basil Pesto Sauce, and its tender flesh holds up nicely when sliced into planks, drizzled with olive oil, and charred on the grill.

title: Peach Black Tea Scented Candle
description: Ever since we added a “Home, Bath & Beauty” category to our annual Trader Joe’s Customer Choice Awards ballot, our lidded, limited-edition, seasonally-Scented Candles have collectively nabbed the top spot. It’s no wonder why — between their bargain-basement price, their big burn-time (approx. 20 hours), their natural soy wax blend, and their unbeatably realistic scents, they simply can’t be beat. Next up in the rotation? Trader Joe’s Peach Black Tea Scented Candle!With a TJ’s Peach Black Tea Scented Candle and the flick of a match, the air will fill with the fragrance of fresh peaches and oh-so-slightly-astringent black tea. In candle-speak, “throw” is the term used to describe how well a candle’s scent circulates throughout a space, i.e., the amount of area through which the scent travels when given adequate time to release... And ladies and gentlefolks, let’s just say that, like our whole lineup of luminaries, this Candle has good throw. Close your eyes, and you’ll swear you’re sitting on the steps of a southern front porch at sunset, sipping your peach iced tea in the warm summer breeze. But hurry — we suspect the sun will set on our supply before summer’s end...

title: Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes
description: It’s true what the say: breakfast really is the most important meal of the day. But that doesn’t mean it has to be the most labor-intensive. In fact, with Trader Joe’s Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes, the only thing separating you from a stack of scrumptious, home-style, bite-sized Pancakes is a minute or two in the microwave. That means you have all the more time to focus on what might be the most important part of such an important meal: what, exactly, you’ll choose to top them with!With their subtly savory, from-scratch taste, our Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes are a natural fit with our Organic Vermont Maple Syrup. That’s hardly where we’d stop, however: hot from the microwave, these Organic Pancakes are especially delicious with a pat of melty butter, a cool dollop of whipped cream (or Coconut Whipped Topping, for that matter), or even a scoop of ice cream. And we simply adore them with sliced strawberries, sweet fruit preserves, or a nice spread of Speculoos Cookie Butter.

title: Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes
description: It’s true what the say: breakfast really is the most important meal of the day. But that doesn’t mean it has to be the most labor-intensive. In fact, with Trader Joe’s Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes, the only thing separating you from a stack of scrumptious, home-style, bite-sized Pancakes is a minute or two in the microwave. That means you have all the more time to focus on what might be the most important part of such an important meal: what, exactly, you’ll choose to top them with!With their subtly savory, from-scratch taste, our Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes are a natural fit with our Organic Vermont Maple Syrup. That’s hardly where we’d stop, however: hot from the microwave, these Organic Pancakes are especially delicious with a pat of melty butter, a cool dollop of whipped cream (or Coconut Whipped Topping, for that matter), or even a scoop of ice cream. And we simply adore them with sliced strawberries, sweet fruit preserves, or a nice spread of Speculoos Cookie Butter.

title: Large Reusable Insulated Bag, Teal
description: Our large Insulated Bags have appeared in many different colors. Past hues include yellow, purple, periwinkle, orange, green, emerald, red, and magenta. Given that these bags are helpful for keeping chilled items cold, we thought it made total sense to add a Teal-colored Insulated Bag to this collection.The color is a deep, blue-green—a “frozen” hue that would be at home in a scene from that cool, musical, kids’ movie. (“Do you want to go to TJ’s?”) Dimensionally, this Bag is more than one foot deep, and it’s a foot-and- a-half long, with the capacity for about eight gallons of groceries. The padded insides and zippered lid of this reusable shopping Bag will help keep cold your fresh meat, ice cream, mac ‘n cheese, milk, butter, guacamole... as you traverse from our refrigerators to yours.And like our other-colored Insulated Bags, this one has extra sturdy, reinforced straps that are long enough to sling over your shoulder for easy carrying. There’s even a convenient internal pocket for your keys and money while you’re shopping—or to hold napkins and utensils when you take this Teal tote on your next picnic!

title: Tikka Masala Curry Sauce
description: Rich in flavor, vibrantly hued, luxuriously creamy, and exhilaratingly aromatic, tikka masala is one of those dishes that’s truly capable of captivating all of one’s senses at once—even just the sound of it simmering is enough to pique our appetites. It also happens to be a dish that’s spectacularly suited to vegan variations, like the recipe we use in Trader Joe’s Tikka Masala Curry Sauce. Each batch is made with a savory, velvety base that includes onion, tomato paste, and ground watermelon seeds, and flavored with a selection of seasonings and spices including garlic, turmeric, tamarind, and ginger. Altogether, this Tikka Masala Sauce is great for crafting Curries that will enchant the senses of vegans and non-vegans alike.Conveniently shelf table (until opened) and endlessly customizable, our Tikka Masala Curry Sauce is a great for everything from quick weeknight dinners to weekly meal prep. Simply choose your veggies (diced potatoes, peas, and cauliflower are always a good start) and a protein (tofu or lentils to keep it plant-based, chicken to keep it classic), sauté them all in a saucepan until cooked through, then add the Sauce and simmer for a few minutes. Once your Curry is ready, you’re free to serve over basmati rice or Organic Riced Cauliflower, and accessorize with sides like Naan and Mini Vegetable Samosas.

title: Pita Chips
description: From their salty, toasty flavor to their resounding, baked-not-fried crunch, Trader Joe’s Pita Chips are true staples of the snack aisle. With their distinguished dipping power and versatility, they’re practically tailor-made for serving alongside any dip, salsa, or Mediterranean dish you can imagine. They’re just substantial enough to hold the heft of hummus, and just straightforward enough to augment the awesomeness of flavorful fare like TJ’s Almond Chipotle Dip—all while remaining light and crispy enough to support straight-from-the-bag snacking, too! You could even crumble them and use them in place of croutons in a Greek salad. Options, people.

title: Mango Sticky Rice Crisps
description: It would be difficult to overstate just how delicious a plate of mango sticky rice can be. From that refreshing initial bite of the buttery sliced mango, to the soft, chewy texture of the coconut milk-saturated rice, to the way those contrasting flavors and textures play off of one another on the palate, it’s an unquestionably top-tier dessert. The question that Trader Joe’s Mango Sticky Rice Crisps asks is “can a top-tier dessert also become a top-tier snack?” We’re confident that every satisfyingly sweet and crunchy bite of these Crisps will answer that question with a resounding, “Of course! It’s Mango Sticky Rice! What can’t it do?!”Made for us by an expert supplier Thailand, Trader Joe’s Mango Sticky Rice Crisps are made with a mix of sticky rice, coconut milk, sweetened dried mango, mango syrup, and sesame seeds. Each bite evokes the tropical sweetness, bright fruity flavors, and faint, toasty nuttiness of this classic, Southeast Asian sweet treat, while adding the textural twist of overt crunchiness into the mix. Aside from making a truly excellent anytime snack (which they do with aplomb), these Crisps are also great for enjoying as a show-stealing amuse-bouche between bites of charcuterie, deploying as a mini-dessert for a spicy, savory meal, or idly crunching on while watching a movie or catching up on your shows.

title: Cacay Oil Body Butter
description: Just in time for summer, Trader Joe's Cacay Oil Body Butter has arrived to help keep your skin soothed, moisturized, and hydrated from now until autumn! It's made with a base of smooth and silky coconut oil and shea butter, to which our supplier adds vegan-sourced collagen-supporting peptides and squalane, as well as moisturizing Cacay Oil. In addition to its skin-nourishing properties, it's also scented with a light and elegant pink dragonfruit and jasmine fragrance, to leave you feeling refreshed after every use.Derived from the seeds of the South American Cacay tree's fruit, and celebrated the world over for its cosmetic and culinary qualities, Cacay Oil is naturally rich with linoleic acid, making it an ideal moisturizer. Normally, that would also make it a candidate for a sky-high retail-we've seen similar creams on the market go or as much as $48. But since this is Trader Joe's, you can find an eight-ounce tub of our Cacay Oil Body Butter for a fraction of a fraction of that price. While supplies last, you can pick one up as a gift for a loved one, an addition to your collection of spa-day essentials, or a bit of portable self-care to bring along on a summertime trip.

title: Italian Whole Peeled Tomatoes with Basil Leaf
description: It’s a true cultural wonder that the “plump fruit” (as the Aztecs used to call it) once only found in South America, is today most closely associated with a particular, boot-shaped nation that’s an ocean away. Part of the reason for this is that Italians use tomatoes in so many delicious dishes, from pasta & pizza sauces to salads & soups. Trader Joe’s Italian Whole Peeled Tomatoes are not only ready to use in all those dishes and more, but they also possess the cachet that comes with being grown & packed in Italy!Each 28-ounce can is filled with juicy, deep-red, Roma tomatoes that are grown in the Puglia region of Italy (aka the ‘heel of the boot’). These particular ‘plump fruits’ are picked at peak harvest near the end of summer. The Tomatoes are then quickly delivered to Naples, where they are peeled & packed with tomato juice and Basil Leaves. And by quickly, we mean they go from harvest-to-can in just 12 hours!The colorful cans are then delivered to your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, where you can pick them up for use in the dishes your home is known for. Blend up these beauts (Basil, juice, and all) to use in your homemade pasta sauce. Drain them, halve them, and drop them in simmering chicken soup, or scatter them atop TJ’s Pizza Dough with Fresh Mozzarella Pearls and Organic Basil. You’ll find colorful cans of Trader Joe’s Italian Whole Peeled Tomatoes with Basil Leaf on our shelves, every day.

title: Eliros Extra Virgin Olive Oil
description: In a nation known for its rich, flavorful olives, the island of Crete just might be the jewel in Greece’s olive- wreathed crown. Here, among the sloping, seaside hills, family-owned farms have cultivated olives for generations stretching back to the furthest edges of antiquity. Available at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s for a limited time, Eliros Extra Virgin Olive Oil comes to us from a collective of these small, family farms, who hand-pick Koroneiki olives and cold extract them (which is to say, spin them in a centrifuge until the oil seperates from the fruit, all while keeping everything below 80°F). The cold extraction process further preserves the olives’ rich flavor, resulting in a lush, buttery, and delightfully tangy EVOO that’s especially suited for drizzling over grilled fish, finishing off a well-seared steak, and dipping with a nice hunk of bread.While many of the olive oils we carry on an everyday basis are excellent for cooking, Eliros Extra Virgin Olive Oil should be considered more of a finishing oil—we find that its full flavors and peppery notes hold up best when left unheated. Try drizzling it over a sheet pan of roasted veggies, mixing it into bold and full-bodied salad dressings, or giving it a toss with freshly cooked ravioli or tortellini just prior to serving. And you truly can’t go wrong simply dipping it with a bit of focaccia or toasty baguette, as-is or seasoned with aromatic herbs, grated Parmesan cheese, and sweet Balsamic Vinegar.

title: Dark Chocolate Dipped French Butter Cookies
description: Just about everyone loves butter cookies. If they’re French butter cookies, there’s an expectation that those cookies are going to be truly great. And what if those French butter cookies are also dipped in dark chocolate? Well, that’s what we call a must-try, confection tri-fecta! It’s also what we call Trader Joe’s Dark Chocolate Dipped French Butter Cookies.These Cookies are, indeed, made for us in France. The usual cookie-dough suspects—flour, sugar, egg yolks, milk, leavening, and salt—are combined with cultured French butter (13% of the recipe) to create a dough that is shaped into thin rounds. The baked biscuits are coated in rich, Dark Chocolate (40% of the recipe), yielding an exquisite Cookie that is at the same time: smooth, crunchy, chocolate-y, and buttery!You’ll find these Dark Chocolate Dipped French Butter Cookies on our shelves, every day. And that’strès bienbecause once you taste them, you’ll want to know that you can get some anytime you want!

title: Tropical Bahia Brazil Small Lot Coffee
description: It turns out that a long drive, a closed truck, and hot weather are the perfect combination for a truly special brew. Enter Trader Joe’s Tropical Bahia Brazil Small Lot Coffee!After harvesting, coffee beans need hot, arid weather to thoroughly dry before roasting. The high growing regions of Bahia, Brazil aren’t blessed with such conditions, so growers send their beans away to sunnier regions—this journey is where the Tropical Bahia Brazil magic happens.Ripe Arabica coffee beans spend the long drive in a hot, closed truck. These conditions set off a fermentation process that, unlike the controlled and monitored process for most coffee, happens naturally and with minimal interference. Such spontaneity gives Tropical Bahia Brazil its unique character. A medium roast results in a balanced coffee that boasts layered flavors, notes of sweet fruits, and a touch of acidity.Once in our hands, the beans are packed in bags with one-way valves that keep oxygen out—this helps to preserve their singular flavor. Brew hot for an interesting morning cup, pair with fruit pastries like Raspberry Croissant Carré and Strawberry & Rhubarb Hand Pies, or enjoy over ice with a splash of milk (or a non-dairy alternative) for an afternoon pick-me-up.Tropical Bahia Brazil is part of our Small Lot Coffee program, which means quantities are truly small. Pick up a bag and brew a cup while it’s on our shelves!

title: Organic Assam Golden Black Tea
description: Much like a wine or cheese, the quality of any given tea is highly dependent on where it was harvested. For certain teas, however, when it was harvested is just as, if not more, important. For example, during the first few weeks of spring, as assamica tea plants in northwestern India begin to mature, their first flush of leaf buds end in a distinct, golden tip. These golden-tipped leaves are prized for being richer, sweeter, and even slightly higher in caffeine than standard Assam leaves (which are already quite excellent)—and they’re exactly what you’ll find in every box of Trader Joe’s Organic Assam Golden Black Tea.Bold and malty, with a faintly fruity profile, this full-flavored Assam Golden Black Tea is cultivated for us using organic practices in India’s bountiful Brahmaputra valley, nestled in the state of Assam (from which this tea gets its name, in fact). It serves just as well hot or iced, as-is or with a splash of milk or your favorite non-dairy creamer. We find that its strong character and notes of toasted rice make it a lovely pairing option for breakfast pastries, fresh fruit, or a nice, sharp Cheddar cheese. And just as timing is important to this tea’s harvest, it’s also paramount if you want to pick up a box at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, because supplies of this Organic Assam Golden Black Tea are decidedly limited.

title: Yuzu Miso Topping & Spread
description: Combining two iconically Japanese ingredients into one uniquely delicious sauce, Trader Joe’s Yuzu Miso Topping & Spread is a curiously captivating condiment, unlike any other we’ve offered before. On tasting it, you’ll likely first notice its rich, luxuriously thick consistency, then the savory, umami-filled notes of its white miso paste base, which perfectly leads into the pleasantly tart tones of its mixed-in yuzu zest and yuzu juice. Then, once you’ve had a chance to take it all in, the elegant balance between its savory and citric elements ought to immediately inspire you with all the possibilities for where you can use it..And indeed, the possibilities are practically endless: it’s spectacular spread over grilled seafood, it’s stupendous on a seared steak, and it adds remarkable depth of flavor to roast chicken. But that’s just the beginning. From the simple (drizzled over a bowl of plain white rice, dunked with Handsome Cut Potato Fries or Organic Chicken Nuggets) to the sophisticated (mixed into marinades for pork ribs, served alongside charcuterie boards, or as a spread for an especially ornate sandwich), Trader Joe’s Yuzu Miso Topping & Spread will add an unmistakeably umami, tantalizingly tart element to them all.

title: Apricot Cardamom Spread
description: With its pungent, peppery warmth, complex floral notes, and zesty hints of citrus, it’s no surprise that cardamom is currently enjoying a moment in the culinary spotlight. In keeping with that spirit of sweetly spiced exploration of flavor, our product developer worked with a Belgian supplier known for their high quality fruit spreads to craft the newest, limited-edition addition to our grocery shelves, just in time for summer. Introducing Trader Joe’s Apricot Cardamom Spread!Made with an impressive 55% Apricot, this thick, sweet-tart Spread offers the sunny notes of its namesake stone fruit, commingled with the pleasant warmth of Cardamom. Spiced (but not overly so), this brightly flavored, fiery orange-hued Spread is an able accompaniment to cheese—think slices of sharply flavored Grana Padano Parmesan or velvety Triple Creme Brie to complement its natural acidity—and would be equally at home on a toasted English Muffin or AB&ACS (Almond Butter and Apricot Cardamom Spread) sandwich.

title: Crunchy Jicama Slaw
description: When you have a crisp cadre of fresh-cut veggies, paired with a flavorful dressing, who can be against the slaw? In the case of Trader Joe’s Crunchy Jicama Slaw, that truly a root-torical question!Our Slaw comes from Mexico, like the original Jicama root itself. Jicama “noodles” make up the base of this salad, with julienned carrots and diced radishes, cucumbers, and red bell peppers. The addition of shelled edamame brings a bit of protein to the party—3g per one-cup serving, to be precise.Inside the 11.5-ounce tub, the Slaw is topped with plenty of leafy, fragrant cilantro. Plus, there’s a garnish-ready packet of chopped, dry-roasted peanuts for a finishing, nutty crunch. And no slaw-abiding denizen of TJ’s salad-town would expect anything less than the spicy, sesame ginger dressing that comes in a separate packet, ready to add and toss with the veggies—whenever you’re ready to eat. On that note, we’re ready when you’re ready; Trader Joe’s Crunchy Jicama Slaw can be found every day in our refrigerators!

title: Simply Amazing Soft Dried Apricots
description: Large, Dried Apricots—of the juicy, Suphany variety—ripen in the sun to a blush-orange hue, while also developing a rich, honey-like sweetness. Once harvested, they’re carefully dried in the summer sun by our trusted Turkish apricot supplier (and by Mother Nature, of course). What really makes these Dried Apricots Simply Amazing is the final step, which involves a gentle steaming. This unique method yields unbelievably Soft Apricots with a tender, chewy, almost velvety texture. Each bite of these reddish gems presents a floral, candy-like quality that is tempered by a pleasant tang.Because they are harvest-dependent, we’re offering Trader Joe’s Simply Amazing Soft Dried Apricots only for a limited time. When in season, you’ll find them on our shelves alongside our simply amazing assortment of dried fruits and nuts.

title: Vanilla Bean Whole Milk Greek Yogurt
description: If you’re not yet a fan, after one spoonful you’ll be delighted by Vanilla Bean Greek Whole Milk Yogurt. Greek Yogurt, best known for its tart flavor and thick texture, becomes all the more velvety when made with Grade A Whole Milk, and boasts an impressive 12 grams of protein per serving. You’ll notice those characteristic little black specks throughout the product—those are pieces of Vanilla Bean that deliver flavor you can see as well as taste (heavy on the taste), further buoyed by the addition of natural vanilla flavor.Mix our Vanilla Bean Greek Yogurt with a hearty scoop of Just the Clusters Vanilla Almond Granola Cereal for an extra crunch and an easy breakfast or snack. Or, use this Yogurt in place of ice cream and sprinkle in some Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips for a sweet, dessert-y treat.

title: Carrot Mini Sheet Cake
description: Whose idea was it to put carrot in a cake anyway? In Medieval Europe, sugar was so inaccessible that the populace had to get creative with satisfying its sweet tooth. Abundant in quantity and sufficiently sweet, carrots got the job done—and then some. Not only did they contribute understated sweetness; they also increassed moisture content to keep desserts fluffy. Taking notes from both Medieval masses and grandmas of yore, Trader Joe’s festively spiced Carrot Mini Sheet Cake evokes nostalgia with every bite.Shredded carrots and warm spices are baked together in a sweet and nutty base. Speaking of nuts, walnuts lend just enough bite to contrast the cake’s moist and tender crumb. As with our mainstay Mini Sheet Cakes, cream cheese icing ribbons top off each slice with a tinge of tanginess and creamy texture.There’s no baking or heating necessary for this scrumptious cake. Go right ahead and serve after weeknight dinners, add candles for birthday celebrations, or gift a whole sheet to the carrot cake lover in your life.Carrot Mini Sheet Cake is available in our bakery section for a limited time, so make haste to your neighborhood Trader Joe’s!

title: Cracker Assortment
description: The big party is approaching. The plans are set, the food is nearly ready, but something is missing, something that will tie together all the disparate culinary creations that come to the table. That certain something that will make the cheeses cheesier, the dips more dippable, and the spreads more spreadable. It’s the crackers. Face it: without the right crackers, all will be lost. And “all will be lost” does not make for a happy happening. Every party is saved with the addition of Trader Joe’s Cracker Assortment.The crispy, crunchy contents of this Assortment cover all the cracker angles – yes, even the round crackers cover your angles. Inside are four varieties of perfect party crackers, wrapped in individual sleeves to maximize freshness. You’ll find Original and Cracked Pepper & Poppy Seed Water Crackers, plus Vegetable and Wheat “Entertainer” Crackers. The Water Crackers are light and crispy, ideal crackers for dips, cheese, or canapé-style toppings. The Entertainers work for pretty much everything – they’re substantial and almost buttery, making them quite remarkable with cheeses. Whether you’re hosting a grand dinner party, a quick cocktail hour, or simply in the mood for a spontaneous cheese and cracker night, this Assortment has you covered.

title: Pumpkin Butter
description: Trader Joe’s Pumpkin Butter doesn’t actually contain butter, but it does have a distinctively rich, butter- like consistency – partially attributable to its fruit pulp-to-sugar ratio, which is higher than that of jam or preserves. Pumpkin puree is cooked slowly, in small batches, with sugar, honey and spices, so the spices have plenty of time to marry with the pumpkin. Our Pumpkin Butter is smooth and light yet decadent tasting. In fact, it tastes much like pumpkin pie, except there are no eggs or cream in this spread, and thus no fat. Shocking, really, once you’ve tasted it.How should you use Pumpkin Butter? That’s entirely up to you, of course, but we’re happy to start you off with some ideas. Heat it and pour over vanilla ice cream for a pumpkin sundae. Spread it on toast, waffles, a bagel, or our Buttermilk Biscuits for breakfast. Make a peanut butter and Pumpkin Butter sandwich. You could also take equal parts Pumpkin Butter and cream and heat, stirring well, to create a creamy pumpkin sauce to serve atop ravioli or tortellini.

title: Caesar Salad with White Chicken Meat
description: Hail, Caesar Salad! Since its invention in the 1920s, the Caesar has reigned supreme as a scion of salad- dom — although, full disclosure, it actually gets its name from its reported inventor, chef Caesar Cardini; any similarities to Roman emperors are purely coincidental. And for close to three decades, Trader Joe’s Caesar Salad with Chicken has remained a staple of our salad selection. Inspired by the classic recipe, it’s made with crisp Romaine lettuce, fresh shreds of Parmesan, crunchy croutons, and tender chunks of chicken breast, with a packet of zesty, creamy, and triumphantly garlicky Caesar dressing included.Once mixed together, this Salad exhibits everything you love about the iconic Caesar profile — the crunch, the rich flavors, the savory notes of garlic and anchovy — all in one conveniently portable package. Perhaps it’s the princely air that comes with enjoying such a sumptuous salad in a mundane setting, but even after all these years, it remains one of our favorite lunch salads to bring to work. Keep an eye out for nine ounce packages of Trader Joe’s Caesar Salad with Chicken in our refrigerators the next time you’re looking to conquer your hunger.

title: Flour Tortillas
description: When it comes to making bold & flavorful, burritos, captivatingly melty quesadillas, or rich and tasty wraps, it’s important to have a good flour tortilla at the ready. That’s why we proudly offer Trader Joe’s Flour Tortillas in our bakery section. They’re crafted for us by a renowned, family-owned tortilla maker in Southern California, who’s been making tortillas for Trader Joe’s for more than 35 years. At about ten inches in diameter, these soft and pliable Flour Tortillas are the ideal size for building burritos—but that’s hardly where we’d stop.Our Flour Tortillas are superb for serving with a plate of sizzling fajitas made with our Carne Asada Autentica and Fire Roasted Bell Peppers & Onions. They’re phenomenal for rolling up and deep- frying homemade flautas with our Pulled Chicken Chili Verde. We even find that they make for a quick and easy, midday snack: simply warm them up a bit in a toaster oven or microwave, then apply a quick layer of butter and cracked black pepper or cinnamon sugar.

title: Meyer Lemon Cookie Thins
description: An “Old World Recipe” for the new age shopper, Trader Joe’s Meyer Lemon Cookie Thins are an elegantly simple, refreshing, and flavor-filled treat. Using real Meyer lemon oils, these Cookie Thins exhibit the allure of this sought after lemon variety. Without the tang of “regular” lemons, Meyer lemons are a much more mellow sweetness that lends itself wonderfully to baking and using in sweeter applications than traditional lemon varieties.Taking a simple recipe, real citrus flavor, and baking it into graceful little crisps with delicately scalloped edges, Trader Joe’s Meyer Lemon Cookie Thins are bound to put a pleasant pucker on your lips. And don’t think of them as exclusively a saccharine snack option, consider using with a few of our quirky cheeses or dips such as our Baked Lemon Ricotta Cheese, Everything but the Bagel Greek Style Yogurt Dip, or our Authentic Lemon Curd.

title: Pizza Seasoned Crackers
description: Trader Joe’s Pizza Seasoned Crackers are the mini, snackable version of pizza you didn’t know you needed!Originating in Naples, pizza marinara is likely the oldest variety of tomato-topped pizza, and is the flavor profile we draw from for these unique Crackers. True to the source material, they’re generously seasoned with the pizza marinara trinity of tangy tomatoes, aromatic oregano, and a kick of garlic. Thin, wheat-based Crackers stand in for pizza crust to facilitate satisfying crispiness, optimal snackability, and an uncanny resemblance to the real deal.To make the Crackers extra pizza-like, we recommend swinging by our cheese section and scooping up your cheese of choice—we’re partial to All Natural Fresh Mozzarella Cheese. Add cold cheese slices for a lighter feel, or melt them slightly for peak pizza replication. Pour a glass of Italian red wine (like Villa Cerrina Montepulciano D’Abruzzo), or a pint of pilsner for elevated snackage during evening wind-downs and cozy gatherings with family and friends. Any way you slice it, Pizza Seasoned Crackers make for fun and flavorful munchies whenever you’re feeling peckish!

title: Ginger Shrimp Lo Mein
description: The classic Chinese-American restaurant menu has nearly too many hits to name. Wonton soup? An absolute winner. Chow mein? A total chart-topper. Fried rice? A certified phenom. And for the newest addition to our frozen entrée assortment, we’re drawing inspiration from one of the greatest hits of them all: lo mein. Made for us by a longtime supplier in Thailand who specializes in succulent shrimp dishes, Trader Joe’s Ginger Shrimp Lo Mein offers all the same rich aromatics, savory flavors, and tantalizingly toothsome textures that made lo mein such a legend in the first place.Inside each package of Trader Joe’s Ginger Shrimp Lo Mein, you’ll find a pack of wheat noodles, a medley of veggies including white cabbage and bell peppers, and a pouch of raw shrimp in a savory ginger-shiitake sauce. All it takes is a few minutes of sautéeing in a skillet for these ingredients to go from frozen to steamy, fragrant, and ready to eat. Ginger Shrimp Lo Mein can be enjoyed on its own as an entrée for one or two, or combined with other dishes as part of a family-style feast: we particularly like pairing it with some garlicky, stir-fried Baby Broccoli, and a plate of steamed Chicken Gyoza Potstickers.

title: GT's Guava Paloma Agua de Kefir
description: You’ve probably heard of kombucha, and maybe you’ve heard of kefir... but have you heard ofwater kefir? If not, the shelves of Trader Joe’s just might be the place to learn about it, courtesy of Agua de Kefir™ Guava Paloma. It comes to us from the folks at GT’s®. whose work you may recognize from the fabulously flavorful kombuchas that we carry in our refrigerators. Inspired by the classic paloma cocktail, this flavorful, fermented drink combines the tart and tropical flavors of grapefruit juice and guava purée (along with a bit of habanero juice for a subtle hint of spice) with tangy (and decidedly dairy-free) water kefir that provides billions of probiotic bacteria in every single bottle.Each bottle of Agua de Kefir™ Guava Paloma starts with tiny kefir “grains,” which are actually grain-free, dairy-free granules made from a combination of lactic acid, bacteria, & yeast. When these “grains” are placed in reverse osmosis-filtered water along with organic cane sugar, they literally begin to eat the sugar & ferment. This fermentation yields carbon dioxide & more lactic acid, creating a stable environment for the cultures to grow and multiply. (Kombucha & “regular” kefir—the dairy kind—come from similar processes, but the kefir grains are activated in tea and milk, respectively, instead of in water.) And on top of all these probiotic properties, we’re happy to report that Agua de Kefir™ Guava Paloma is also remarkably refreshing. We recommend bringing a bottle along for a work lunch, for sipping during a hike, or as a pick-me-up after a strenuous yoga session.

title: Smoked Ghost Pepper Cheddar Cheese
description: Things are heating up in the Trader Joe’s cheese section this summer! Made for us by a renowned Wisconsin creamery that’s known for their sharp, rich Cheddars, a trio of hot chili peppers is mixed into every batch of Trader Joe’s Smoked Ghost Pepper Cheddar Cheese before the whole wheel is smoked over aromatic hickory. Together, the capsaicin-laden combo of jalapeño, habanero, and fiery hot Ghost Pepper, along with its subtly smoky tones give this newest addition to our Spotlight Cheese program a uniquely savory and delightfully (though not overwhelmingly) spicy flavor profile.A treat for true heat-seekers and less experienced spice fans alike, our Smoked Ghost Pepper Cheddar can be enjoyed totally on its own, or as part of a larger cheese board or charcuterie spread, where it will add an elegant element of contrasting heat and smoke. We find that it’s especially suited, however, for shredding and sprinkling over and into other savory dishes and snacks. Try it on a chili dog, rolled into a hearty breakfast burrito, or folding into a full-flavored quesadilla. Just be sure to seek out this Smoked Ghost Pepper Cheddar before it’s too late, because supplies are limited. To paraphrase an old adage, the cheese that burns twice as hot lasts half as long on the shelf!

title: Peach Raspberry Crisp
description: Nothing quite captures the essence of summer like seasonal fruit, and a little extra sweetness and crunch takes things to an entirely new level. Enter: Trader Joe’s Peach Raspberry Crisp, a delightfully sweet, tart, and buttery pastry that tastes just like summer.Dating back to at least the 1920s, crisps forego pastry crust in favor of a, well, crispy oat crumble baked over a fruity filling. Our Peach Raspberry Crisp takes a summery spin on the classic pastry with ripe, sweetened peaches and raspberries baked underneath a crunchy, all-butter streusel.While you can dig right in after opening, we recommend baking in the oven ‘til the topping reaches optimal crispiness. Any way you serve it, this crisp shines as a Sunday brunch pastry, backyard barbecue dessert, or as a fruity pick-me-up after a long summer day.Summer is fleeting, and so is our Peach Raspberry Crisp—get it from the bakery section while you can!

title: Chocolate Brooklyn Babka
description: Chocolate Brooklyn Babka is a sweet, swirly brioche-meets-cake loaf rooted in Eastern European Jewish traditions. In both Polish and Yiddish, “babka” is the diminutive of “baba,” meaning “grandmother.” And the character of this sweet, fluffy, chocolate-laden cake lives up to its namesake—welcoming you with open arms and old-world charm, just as your baba would.Trader Joe’s Chocolate Brooklyn Babka is made for us by a small, kosher bakery in—where else?—Brooklyn, New York that literally grew out of their grandmother’s kitchen. Following time-honored recipes and baking methods, they make a real babka’s Babka. It doesn’t get much better.Crafted from scratch in small batches, the sweet yeast dough is spread with a rich chocolate filling and twisted by hand before it goes into a high loaf pan to be proofed and baked. The rich veins of chocolate reveal themselves as swirls when the Babka is sliced. Beautiful. Delicious!For those Seinfeldians in the crowd, you know that a Babka will make you a “hero” at a dinner party. For those who never watched the sitcom, take our word for it—it’s a sensational dessert, fully of dessert heroism. Of course, if you want to champion breakfast, it’s a sure thing, too. Great with a cup of coffee or a glass of chilled milk, served warm or at room temperature, “You can’t beat a Babka!” And you can’t beat our price on Babkas, either.

title: Hyaluronic Moisture Boost Serum
description: Ah, the epidermis—or, in layperson’s terms, skin. As your body’s largest and fastest-growing organ, your skin regulates your temperature, permits various sensations, and protects you from microbes and the elements. It puts in overtime for you, so why not return the favor by incorporating Trader Joe’s Nourish Hyaluronic Moisture Boost Serum into your skincare routine?One of the greatest challenges to maintaining great skin—particularly on the face—is keeping it moisturized. The game plan here is simple, really: do all that you can to lock in your skin’s natural moisture, then add to it as needed. Hyaluronic acid (H.A.) does a little bit of both. A gram of the stuff can attract and hold onto several liters of water., and it helps form a light, non-greasy protective barrier on the skin. Our water-based, unscented, never-tested-on- animals, non-comedogenic Hyaluronic Moisture Boost Serum was formulated by top dermatologists to contain 1% sodium hyaluronate—which is the greatest possible percentage of the pure, salt form of H.A. that we can use without causing the product to bead. Sodium hyaluronate has an even lower molecular weight than hyaluronic acid, so it can penetrate the skin more easily than H.A. can. It’s just what your pretty-but-parched visage needs.Hyaluronic Moisture Boost Serum can be used in conjunction with any and all components of your regular beauty regime, but it particularly complements other products from the TJ’s Nourish line. Twice a day, cleanse with All-In-One Facial Cleanser, apply a small amount of Serum to your entire face (and Antioxidant Facial Serum if desired), then follow with a liberal application of moisturizer. Luminous skin is right around the corner.

title: Roasted Corn
description: Trader Joe’s Roasted Corn is grown in the sunny valleys of Washington State and harvested at the peak of ripeness. It’s then roasted over an open flame, adding a smoky dimension to the corn’s natural sweetness. After roasting, the corn is individually quick frozen to ensure freshness and allow you to use what you like now and save the rest for another time.If you’re looking for a versatile side dish, our Roasted Corn may just fit the bill. The corn is great by itself and fits great with a variety of other combinations, especially in ethnic dishes. Once cooked, toss the amount of Corn you would like to use for a Mexican-style salad with Organic Black Beans, quinoa, cilantro, topped with sweet peppers, onions, avocado and creamy, Cilantro Dressing with crumbled cotija cheese. The Corn makes for a delicious Elote in a cup, also known as Esquites. Just like you would on a corn on the cob, add Real Mayonnaise, grated Cotija Cheese, chili powder, and a Trader Joe’s touch with our crushed Elote Chips. You’ll find each 16-ounce bag of Trader Joe’s Roasted Corn in our freezers.

title: Carb Savvy Tortillas made with Whole Wheat
description: If you are not that carb savvy, you might think 9g of carbohydrates in one serving of Trader Joe’s Carb Savvy Tortillas is not that impressive. In fact, for someone watching their carbs, it’s excellent!Carb Savvy Tortillas contain less overall carbs than regular tortillas, and the carbs they do contain are mostly from dietary fiber. Accordingly, these reduced-carb tortillas are an excellent source of dietary fiber, providing 6g per tortilla. That’s 21% of your daily recommended value of fiber!Enjoy them just as you would less-carb-savvy tortillas. Their smaller size is great for quesadillas, jumbo tacos, or even just for snacking. Find them every day on our bread shelves.

title: Organic Energy Juice Shot
description: We certainly don’t mean to cast any aspersions, but we’ve tried our fair share of other cold-pressed juices and juice shots out there, and, in the spirit of “if you can’t say something nice, don’t say anything at all,” well... we’ll leave it at that. When we go for a juice shot, we like a lot of flavor, a lot of freshness, and not a large price tag. That’s why we’re excited to bring Trader Joe’s Organic Energy Juice Shots to our fridge. Made with a mix of organic orange juice, mango purée, and spinach juice, as well as organic green tea extract, each Shot contains just about the same amount of caffeine as a cup of cooffee, and all for around half the price you’d pay for that same cup of coffee at your corner café.Bottled under high pressure processing (HPP) to maintain the safety of the juice and quality of the flavor, these Shots are perfectly portioned and ready to toss into a backpack, gym bag or lunch box for a sweet and tropical boost of Energy. We find that they’re especially useful for bringing along on your morning commute, on a hike, or during a long plane ride or road trip—any ocassion, really, where a green tea extract-powered pick-me-up might prove helpful.

title: Sliced Black Truffle Monterey Jack Cheese
description: Cool, mellow, and just a touch sweet, Monterey Jack is one of those cheeses that pretty much everyone can agree on—why, even its name makes it sound like a fundamentally friendly fellow. One of our favorite aspects of a good Monterey Jack is how well it serves as a canvas to other flavors—Pepper Jack being one of its most popular permutations. Which lead us to think: what other savory sensations might Monterey Jack mingle well with? That, in turn, lead to some epicurean experimentation, which happily lead to Trader Joe’s Sliced Black Truffle Monterey Jack Cheese.It’s crafted for us by an expert cheesemaker in Wisconsin, who infuses their Jack with bits of black summer truffle before cutting it into sandwich-ready slices. Every bite is savory and satisfying, with a toothsome texture and a distinct touch of truffle-y, umamioomphthat makes it especially great for grilled cheeses, patty melts, and quesadillas. Try it on a burger, melted into an omelet, or, if you’d like a little complementary savory-sweet situation, alongisde some Fresh Cut Cantaloupe Chunks.

title: Peanut Butter Pillows
description: While we certainly love an over-the-top, complicated candy from time to time, there is something about a sublimely simple sweet that’s utterly irresistible. Take Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter Pillows, for instance. Made for us in small batches from an awesomely old-fashioned recipe, these delicately crunchy confections start with layers of crispy, flaky, lightly salted peanut butter, which our supplier then surrounds with a thin (and also rather crispy) candy layer. As you eat them, you can choose to let the layer dissolve on your tongue before biting through the crisp, sweet-savory, peanut butter center, or expedite your sweet-eating experience into one resounding, satisfying*crunch*.Available on our candy shelves for a limited time, Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter Pillows make for a marvelous movie snack, a captivating game-day concession, and a superb sweet treat to bring along on road trips and plane rides. We also find that they make a rather fun inclusion into other sweets and baked goods: the next time you make cookies, try pressing one into the center of each cookie before baking for a melty, pleasantly peanut butter-y result.

title: Green Tea and Yuzu Spread
description: Originally cultivated in mainland East Asia, but now more typically associated with Japanese cuisine, specifically, a yuzu is a refreshingly aromatic citrus with a flavor somewhere between a grapefruit and a Mandarin orange. It’s often paired with sweeter, spicier, and earthier flavors, and makes a particularly great pairing with honey, chile peppers, and green tea. In fact, that last combo is what inspired our uniquely delicious, summer-seasonal, Trader Joe’s Green Tea & Yuzu Spread.It’s crafted for us in small batches by a supplier in Belgium, who’s particularly adept at combining complementary ingredients to create uniquely rich flavor profiles. In this case, they mix Green Tea that’s been infused with lemongrass, ginger, and orange peel, along with apple and lemon juice concentrates and tantalizingly tart Yuzu juice, resulting in a sweet, citric, marvelously multi-dimensional Spread. Aside from making an excellent jelly for your morning toast or muffin, it also provides a pronounced pop of flavor when spread on sandwiches, over roast chicken and fish, or mixed into marinades. And when you’ve got friends over for a charcuterie board or cheese plate, trust us: adding a bit of Green Tea & Yuzu Spread will make those savory flavors truly sing.

title: Organic Apple Cinnamon Fruit Sauce Crushers
description: The full panoply (or should we say, panapple-y) of Trader Joe’s Organic Fruit Sauce Crushers includes Apple Strawberry, Apple Mango, Apple Banana, Apple Carrot, and of course the original, Apple. Now, our latest Crush includes a fall-famous spice that’s about as apple-friendly as one could be!Trader Joe’s Organic Apple Cinnamon Fruit Sauce Crushers are simple in construction, and profoundly classic on the palate. It only takes three ingredients to create this taste: organic apple purée, organic cinnamon powder, and ascorbic acid (to maintain color). Unscrew the top, raise it to your mouth, and give it a gentle squeeze. You’ll experience sweet, crushed Apple, and warm, woody Cinnamon—blended into a Fruit Sauce that is ideal for an anytime snack, and enticing for people of all ages.Unopened, each 3.17-ounce pouch is shelf-stable, which means you can take them on an outing where refrigeration may be hard to come by. You can also store extra in your pantry, so you’re never out. Add a refreshing aspect to these Crushers by keeping them chilled in your fridge. You might even freeze some for a super-cool snack when you’re enjoying the summer sun!

title: Organic Peanut Butter & Cocoa Crunch
description: Peanut butter & chocolate candy. Peanut butter & chocolate cookies. Peanut butter & chocolate cake. These are all delicious treats, and each highlights in a special way the taste-relationship between PB & C. Missing here is anything tailor-made for breakfast-time enjoyment. With this top of mind, Trader Joe’s Organic Peanut Butter & Cocoa Crunch really delivers, for breakfast and beyond.This cereal begins with Organic corn meal that’s been sweetened and puffed into crunchy, bite-sized spheres. About half of the puffs are flavored with Organic Peanut Butter, and the other half with Organic fair trade Cocoa powder. This combo really delivers on your PB-Chocolate flavor expectations. (If it’s even more chocolate flavor that you’re after, we recommend swapping regular milk out for Trader Joe’s Fair Trade Cocoa Chocolate Milk.Each bowl of gluten free Peanut Butter & Cocoa Crunch presents a pleasing contrast of favored flavors, and a real study in Crunch, though we imagine that your cereal won’t stay in the bowl with milk long enough to get scientific with the exact crunch time numbers. We’re looking forward to waking up to this sweet and crunchy breakfast treat, and enjoying Trader Joe’s Organic Peanut Butter & Cocoa Crunch whenever that PB & C craving arises!

title: Uncured Beef Hot Dogs
description: While most folks would probably peg the hamburger as the most representative American food, we'd have to  throw our support behind the humble hot dog. Aside from its close association with baseball (the American national pastime) and summertime (arguably the most American season, though that's another topic altogether), only pizza comes close to the hot dog in its proliferation of regional variation throughout these United States. Practically every major American state and city has their own specific spin on hot dogs, from the vibrantly vegetal Chicago dog, to the chili-and-onion-smothered dogs of Coney Island, to the bacon-wrapped hot dogs of Los Angeles. And so, to help celebrate the holistically American hot dog, we proudly offer Trader Joe's Uncured Beef Hot Dogs, to be enjoyed in whatever preparation you prefer-from sea to shining sea.Our all-Beef, Uncured Hot Dogs contain no added nitrates or nitrates (except those that occur naturally in sea salt and cultured celery powder), and cook up wonderfully well on the grill, in the frying pan, or immersed in boiling water (or beer, we should add!). Once heated through, they have a fantastically snappy texture to their bite, and take well to all kinds of condiments and fixings. No matter which regional variation you subscribe to, or even if you just enjoy it with a simple drizzle of ketchup and/or mustard, our Hot Dog Buns, and Brioche Hot Dog Buns will make an invaluable vehicle for them.

title: California Roll
description: If you are a Japanese food fan, you probably have a favorite local spot where you like to pop in and have sushi rolls. We’re glad to announce that now you can ‘pop in’ to your neighborhood TJ’s for a Trader Joe’s California Roll next time you’re craving maki.Our California Roll is made in the traditional Japanese style, starting with white rice that’s seasoned with rice vinegar, and layered with a sheet of dried nori seaweed. Before it’s rolled, we add fresh cucumber, avocado, and imitation crab made from Alaskan pollock. It’s finished with a sprinkle of white & black sesame seeds.The Roll is sliced into bite-sized segments that are easily lifted with chopsticks (or fingers) to dip into the included organic soy sauce. We’ve also included a zesty, wasabi-style paste if you want to add a little heat to the sauce. And of course, there are tangy, sweet, pickled ginger slices to cleanse your palate; maybe just before you dig into another Roll!

title: Vegetable Roll
description: If you are a Japanese food fan, you likely have a favorite local spot where you like to pop in and have sushi rolls. We're glad to announce that you can 'pop in' to your neighborhood TJ's for a Trader Joe's Vegetable Roll next time you're craving maki.Our Vegetable Roll is made in the traditional Japanese style, starting with white rice that's seasoned with rice vinegar, and layered with a sheet of dried nori seaweed. Before it's rolled, we add fresh cucumber, avocado, and shredded carrots. It's finished with a sprinkle of white & black sesame seeds.The Roll is sliced into bite-sized segments that are easily lifted with chopsticks (or fingers) to dip into the included organic soy sauce. We've also included a zesty, wasabi-style paste if you want to add a little heat to the sauce. And of course, there are tangy, sweet, pickled ginger slices to cleanse your palate; maybe just before you dig into another Roll!

title: Crispy Jalapeño Pieces
description: During the autumn and winter months, one of our favorite ways to add a bit of savory flavor and a touch of crunchy texture to a dish is our Gourmet Fried Onion Pieces, which you might be most familiar with for their role in a classic green bean casserole. Of course, we certainly don’t stop enjoying adding savory flavor and crunchy texture to dishes during the rest of the year. That’s where Trader Joe’s Crispy Jalapeño Pieces come in. Available in our stores all year round, these captivatingly Crispy bits provide some satisfying savoriness and crunch to anything they’re added to, as well as a nice, even level of Jalapeño heat.These crisps are made for us by a supplier in Thailand, who thinly slices and lightly batters Jalapeño peppers, then fries them to a crisp, golden brown. Just like their onion-based counterparts, we find that these Crispy Jalapeño Pieces are particularly great for adding texture to casseroles and bakes (just think of a Jalapeño- powered green bean casserole or baked mac & cheese!), but that’s hardly where we’d stop. We recommend using them as a topping for salad, sandwiches, hot dogs, rice bowls, roasted veggies, egg scrambles, shepherd’s pie—you name it! And if you’re not necessarily in a cooking mood, they also make an excellent snack, right out of the pouch.

title: Organic Beets
description: We have a contingent of beet fans who’ve celebrated our Steamed and Peeled Baby Beets since the moment they were first introduced. However, there’s a certain type of beet fan—a hardcore beet enthusiast, one might say—who still wants more. For those who revel in the pleasure and versatility of raw, round, red roots, we’ve got good news: Trader Joe’s Organic Beets have arrived!There’s a good deal of beauty in these beets, starting with their appearance—scarlet bulbs, hand harvested and trimmed in the fields. They are rinsed and gently tumbled over brush rollers to remove the dirt—no synthetic fertilizers or pesticides to wash away, here! One more rinse and the beets are bagged by hand and shipped to our warehouses.Once they land in your hands, you’ll discover the amazing culinary flexibility of these earthy, slightly sweet gems. Fresh beets can be prepared in almost any way imaginable: Bake them. Boil them. Grill them, or steam them. Leave them raw and grate, or shred them into salads. Use a mandoline to make large, thin slices that you can oven roast for a colorful alternative to potato chips. Use them in baked goods, stir-frys, smoothies, and just about anything else your brain and hands can cook up.

title: Super Soft Bath Tissue
description: “What’s in a name? That which we call a rose By any other name would smell as sweet”We like to think Juliet meant that because Trader Joe’s Super Soft Bath Tissue has “Super Soft” in the name that she was agreeing that a roll of this feels just like what it says - and maybe even leaves a rosy scent? While the later may not be true, this lavatory luxury is deserving of the ‘super soft’ title. And it doesn’t just cater those currently in the restroom! We’ve gone to create a chlorine bleach free, FSC and Rainforest Alliance certified, septic safe, and recyclable bath tissue that is as kind to your behind as it is to the environment.With six gigantic rolls of 350 2-ply sheets per package, Trader Joe’s Super Soft Bath Tissue is a steal-of- a-deal! If you, too, keep this stocked each and every day, you’ll be spoiling yourself and guests for years of bathroom visits to come. An extravagant comfort such as this will leave you equipped to tackle any and all Super Soft Bath Tissue-needing bathroom business.

title: Shredded Organic Mozzarella Cheese
description: We have no guilt in admitting a freshly opened bag of Trader Joe’s Organic Shredded Mozzarella Cheese is a tempting shortcut to eschew any skinned knuckles and wasted time grating your own mozzarella. While taking the time to make it yourself has its place, we really try our best to deliver you the freshest, softest, and stretchiest Organic Shredded Mozzarella Cheese we can find!Whether oozing off of a slice of pizza or layered in a pan of lasagna, Trader Joe’s Organic Shredded Mozzarella Cheese is ready to include in many dishes for a melted, stringy, and flavorful cheese addition. Our mozzarella fior di latte, the Italian terminology for cow’s milk mozzarella, is made with pasteurized organic part-skim milk, some cheese cultures and vegetable based rennet. Pasta filata, again, an Italian term, but this time for the mozz making process, is as simple as starting with fresh whey and cheese cultures, adding the vegetable rennet, and then heating in water to form a stringy and elastic cheese that can be kneaded and then shredded; ready for you to sprinkle and melt on whatever you’d like!

title: Kosher Dill Pickles
description: Somewhere, a sandwich is lonely. Sure, it’s got bread, cheese and meat. There’s even some leafy green lettuce. What’s missing, you say? It’s the pickle! We don’t mean on the sandwich. There’s a time and place for that—like pickle chips on a burger. No, we’re talking about Trader Joe’s Kosher Dill Pickles that rest on the edge of the plate, eager to complement the soft bread and meat with their salty crunch. That Pickle presence also says: “This sandwich was no accident. It was put together with forethought and care—right down to the pickle on the plate.”We’ll devour zingy Kosher Pickles anytime, anywhere—sandwich or no sandwich! Crack open a jar, and we come a-callin’. All pickle-posturing aside, though, these briny delights really deliver. We jar them in a classic Kosher brine that includes vinegar, salt, mustard seeds, caraway seeds, and natural pickle flavors. You’ll find these on our grocery shelves.

title: Lemon Flower Cookies
description: “The flowers that bloom in the spring, tra la! Breathe promise of merry sunshine.” —Gilbert & SullivanAh, spring. That time of year when nature reawakens, spreading boundless blossoms across the landscape—it’s downright inspiring. In fact, it’s inspired us to celebrate the season the best way we know how: with jammy shortbread cookies. Trader Joe’s Lemon Flower Cookies are made for us by a trusted bakery partner, who starts with a base of beautifully buttery shortbread dough that’s been flavored with lemon oil and colored a pastel yellow with turmeric. After shaping the dough into a fancifully floral shape and baking it to a flawlessly crumbly texture, they then fill the center with a lemon jam, so that every bite sings with a satisfyingly citric sweetness.We invite you to join us in giving a toast to springtime by enjoying a Trader Joe’s Lemon Flower Cookie with a cup of your favorite tea—ideally, something similarly citric, like our always-excellent Organic Earl Grey. They make a handsome addition to a spring-themed dessert board, especially when you have folks over for brunch. And for a truly auspicious sweet treat, we recommend placing a Lemon Flower Cookie or two (or three) into a bowl of our Vanilla Ice Cream swirled with our Authentic Lemon Curd.

title: French Market Sparkling Pink Lemonade
description: In France, lemonade takes on a different meaning. As long as it’s carbonated and lemon-flavored, it qualifies as lemonade. We found a supplier in France that makes one of the best French lemonades, who now makes Trader Joe’s Sparkling Pink Lemonade for us, right from the French Market. Everything about this French drink will have you do a double take – from the fancy curves of the bottle, to the light blush colored drink, to the elegant labeling – you won’t be able to resist picking up a bottle or two (or more, we won’t judge).We’ll say though, this version of lemonade is different than the classic, fresh squeezed lemonade we’re used to, it’s less citrusy than you would expect and it’s bubbly. You’ll have to try for yourself – it’s just simply good, delicious, and a great value. See that guy holding up that glass of lemonade? That’ll be you, toasting to the folks surrounding your dinner table, thankful to have such a fine glass of Trader Joe’s Sparkling Pink Lemonade. I mean seriously, don’t be surprised if you find yourself just start to raise the glass after your first few sips... appreciating the sweet, lemony flavors and bubbly, carbonated fizz.

title: French Market Sparkling Lemonade
description: In France, lemonade takes on a different meaning. As long as it’s carbonated and lemon-flavored, it qualifies as lemonade. We found a supplier in France that makes one of the best French lemonades, who now makes Trader Joe’s Sparkling Lemonade for us, right from the French Market. Everything about this French drink will have you do a double take – from the fancy curves of the bottle, to the subtle lemon-colored drink, to the elegant labeling – you won’t be able to resist picking up a bottle or two (or more, we won’t judge).We’ll say though, this version of lemonade is different than the classic, fresh squeezed lemonade we’re used to, it’s less citrusy than you would expect and it’s bubbly. You’ll have to try for yourself – it’s just simply good, delicious, and a great value. See that guy holding up that glass of lemonade? That’ll be you, toasting to the folks surrounding your dinner table, thankful to have such a fine glass of Trader Joe’s Sparkling Lemonade. I mean seriously, don’t be surprised if you find yourself just start to raise the glass after your first few sips... appreciating the sweet, lemony flavors and bubbly, carbonated fizz.

title: Green Olive Flats Italian Lingue Crackers
description: So named for their resemblance to a tongue, Italian lingue (pronounced LEAN-gweh) crackers may just be the ideal edible instrument on which to serve cheese. They’re traditionally made by rolling savory-seasoned dough into a flat, roughly rectangular, tongue-like shape, then baking them until they’re superlatively crisp and snackable. For Trader Joe’s Green Olive Flats, the newest addition to our snacks section, our supplier in Italy goes the extra step of mixing bits of green olive into theirs, which provides a perfectly piquant briny flavor into every bite.True to tradition, Trader Joe’s Green Olive Flats make a truly exceptional serving surface for all kinds of cheeses: they provide a salty, savory boost when spread with our Triple Cream Brie, create a complementary conversation on the palate when eaten with a slice of herby Asiago with Rosemary and Olive Oil, and accentuate the allium elements of our English Cheddar with Caramelized Onions. Of course, that goes even farther when compounded with some smoky charcuterie, like our very own Prosciutto. And if you just happen to find yourself in need of a savory, crisp cracker, sans meat or cheese, our Green Olive Flats are always an excellent option.

title: Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef Patties
description: One of the great joys of the warmer months is grilling your own burgers at home. Trader Joe’s has always been an enthusiastic supporter of home-grillers, with our top-quality ground beef options, such as 85/15 Organic Grass Fed Ground Beef, and 80/20 Ground Beef Patties. For those looking for a ready- for-the-grill burger with a uniquely flavorful twist, you’ll want to try Trader Joe’s Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef 1/3 lb. Patties.This is a Ground blend of three different whole-muscle cuts of Angus beef. Angus refers to the more muscular Aberdeen Angus cattle breed, which yields meat with plenty of fat marbling. This marbling translates into juicy, tender meat. More specifically, this C.B.P. blend incorporates Angus cuts from the shoulder (Chuck), chest (Brisket), and rump (Picanha). The Brisket (20% of the blend) and Picanha (5%) each contribute amazingly rich flavor, with their slightly fattier composition, while the leaner and more conventional ground Chuck (75%) brings additional ‘beefiness’ and balance.All of this amounts to a Ground Beef blend that is about 75% lean/25% fat—ideal for quick, hot grilling. And the substantial size of these pre-portioned 1/3 lb. Patties allows them to remain tender & juicy, even when cooked over the flames. The resulting bigger burgers will also easily fill TJ’s Brioche Buns to satisfy even the hungriest BBQ-goers—but only for a limited time. Find 21.3-ounce (1 lb. 5.3 oz.) packages of four Trader Joe’s Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef Patties in our refrigerators, while the summer grilling season lasts.

title: Peanut Butter with Honey
description: Peanut butter is an undeniably sought after flavor in some of our customers’ favorite products (e.g., Peanut Butter Pretzels, Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, et al.). As such, our buyers have spent quite a bit of time exploring where else to employ peanut butter. But when they started pondering how we might put other things into peanut butter, we knew they’d hit a gold mine—or, rather, honey pot. Introducing Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter with Honey!Made with just three ingredients—dry roasted peanuts, honey, and salt—the coarse texture of this peanut butter falls somewhere in between creamy and crunchy, giving it loads of textural interest when spread on a sandwich or Whole Wheat English Muffin. The addition of sea salt amplifies the floral sweetness of the honey, and further highlights the round, roasted flavor of the peanuts. Unlike other brands on the market, our Peanut Butter with Honey contains no hydrogenated oils—give it a good stir before enjoying and you’ll be ready to spread with abandon.

title: Organic Mango Vinaigrette Dressing
description: As it turns out, summertime salads positively shine when dressed in a fusion of sweet, tangy, and tropical flavors... And lucky for you, Trader Joe’s Organic Mango Vinaigrette Dressing deftly incorporates each of these attributes, setting the table for some fantastically fresh, summer fare.A fairly simple blend of organic mango purée, vegetable oil, distilled white vinegar, and cane sugar (plus organic orange juice concentrate, dried red bell peppers, and garlic powder for added vim and vigor), our Organic Mango Vinaigrette lends itself to all sorts of applications. You can, of course, add a splash to salads (spinach + feta + toasted almonds + Organic Mango Vinaigrette = yum), or you can use it as a marinade for grilled chicken. Or as a fancy inclusion for fish tacos. Or as the star of a cold noodle dish or pasta salad...

title: Spinach & Ricotta Raviolini
description: Trader Joe’s Spinach & Ricotta Raviolini are tiny ravioli that are made for us in Italy by pasta pillow pros. We call them “pros” because it’s very challenging to fill and keep closed such small ravioli. After a year of research (no joke!)—and equipped with a new, specially made die to cut the pasta—our Raviolini line was up and running.Each Raviolini is 50% pasta and 50% filling, which is a rare ratio in the stuffed-pasta universe. The pasta is formed from a delicate, egg and durum-wheat flour dough. The filling includes spinach in a creamy, garlicky bechamel sauce, with a rich blend of ricotta & mozzarella cheeses.Given their tiny size, these Spinach & Ricotta Raviolini eat very similar to a plate of tortellini, where you get to enjoy a bunch of them in every bite. They’re so delicious on their own, you may simply complement them with a drizzle of TJ’s Extra Virgin Olive Oil and a sprinkle of Shaved Parmigiano Reggiano. And their slight stature means they’re quick cooking and ideal for dropping into a pot of soup just a few minutes before it’s finished simmering! You’ll find 10-ounce packages of Trader Joe’s Spinach & Ricotta Raviolini in our refrigerators, every day.

title: Steamed Vegetable Soup Dumplings
description: From the moment they were introduced, our Steamed Chicken Soup Dumplings and Steamed Pork & Ginger Soup Dumplings became instant sensations among our customers. Inspired by the winsome dim sum tradition of Chinese xiao long bao, these aromatic and savory, soup-filled dumplings are such a darling, in fact, that we’ve received countless requests to make a vegan version, as well. After trying a few variations, our tasting panel found that a mix of jackfruit, carrot, cabbage, spinach, and ginger for the filling, along with a hearty, aromatic broth (made with vegan-friendly agar-agar, rather than gelatin) made for a truly captivating combination—and thus, Trader Joe’s Steamed Vegetable Soup Dumplings were born!Just like our Pork and Chicken variations, our Steamed Vegetable Soup Dumplings can be made in a matter of minutes in the microwave or steamer on your stovetop. Also like their predecessors, once heated through, the soup inside of them does become quite hot—we recommend serving them in a deep spoon, carefully puncturing the top of the side of the dumpling with your teeth or some chopsticks, then letting the soup seep into the spoon to cool down until it’s ready to slurp. We also heartily recommend enjoying them with a bit of Reduced Sodium Soy Sauce and Crunchy Chili Onion for an even more satisfying Soup Dumpling experience.

title: Bubble Waffles
description: If you’re a fan of bubble tea beverages (a.k.a. boba), then chances are you’ve seen Bubble Waffles sold right along with them. Also known as gai daan zai in Cantonese, they first appeared on the Hong Kong street-food scene way back in the 1950s. Later nicknamed “Bubble Waffles,” at least in part for their uncanny resemblance to actual bubble wrap, they’ve been a standby in cafés, sidewalk stalls, and home kitchens ever since... and now, in the freezers at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, too! (We can sense your bubbling joy from here!)Made with coconut milk, wheat flour, cane sugar, rice bran shortening, and vanilla bean paste, our vegan Trader Joe’s Bubble Waffles are fluffy yet chewy, sweet yet savory, and simple yet versatile. Heat them from frozen in your air fryer, toaster oven, or microwave, and their crispy edges and mochi-like middles are ready to be topped with everything from fresh fruit & whipped cream, to Cookie Butter & bananas, to French Vanilla Ice Cream & All Occasion Sprinkle. You can even top them with savory fare, like shredded Le Gruyère Cheese and chopped leeks, or fried eggs and Sriracha Sauce. Really, the sky’s the limit here—don’t let anything burst your Bubbles! Except for you, when you’re eating them, of course.

title: Dark Chocolate Covered Pistachios
description: For just a moment, consider the complementary nature of dark chocolate and pistachios with us, won’t you? In terms of flavor, there’s the earthy, delicately sweet notes of a finely roasted pistachio, which plays remarkably well off of the rich, ever-so-slightly bitter elements of dark chocolate. And texture-wise, the tooth-sinking smoothness of dark chocolate superbly rounds out a pistachio’s tender interior after its initial, delicately snappy bite. It’s like they were made for each other—a match made in snacking heaven, if you will. We certainly will, which is precisely why we’ve introduced Trader Joe’s Dark Chocolate Covered Pistachios to our shelves.Inside each pouch, our supplier has smothered shelled, dry roasted, and salted California Pistachios in a perfectly proportioned layer of deep Dark Chocolate so that each balanced bite takes your taste buds on a trek across the sweet-salty spectrum. They make an unbeatable anytime snack, can be mixed in to your own custom trail mixes, and are especially adept for adding to charcuterie boards and cheese plates, to provide even more captivating contrast. We also find that they make the ideal palate cleanser for serving in between sips at an at- home wine tasting with friends.

title: Mini Insulated Tote Bag - Teal, Magenta
description: Back when we introduced our vibrantly colored, limited-release Insulated Bags, it created quite a stir. Then, when we brought in our delightfully dimunitive (and similarly limited) Mini Canvas Totes, it was nothing short of a sensation. So, now that we’re introducing Trader Joe’s Teal and Magenta Mini Insulated Totes, consider yourself fairly warned: these Totes are totally destined to become the next craze!Made with a marvelous, insulating material to help keep snacks, drinks, and groceries nice and cool, these Mini Insulated Totes are a fun and fashionable way to carry all kinds of goodies to and fro. With their vivid, summer-y shades of bright Magenta and mellow Teal, we find that they’re especially great for toting cold appetizers or chilled six-packs to the beach, a pool party, or a barbeque. That said, they’re also perfectly sized for everyday use, like as a lunchbox for school or work. Just be sure to pick up a Tote or two while you can— supplies are limited, and they’re sure to fly off the shelves!

title: Cotton Picnic Cloths
description: Ah, for the simple pleasures of a summertime picinic. There’s just something about the act of eating outside, amongst nature and friends and family, that makes one feel a littlemoreat peace with the world. Of course, we certainly feel even more at peace with the world when we’ve got a nice napkin to go along with all that (potentially messy) nature and food and fellowship—and that’s precisely why we’re introducing Trader Joe’s Cotton Picnic Cloths to our shelves for the summer season.Made for us by an expert supplier in Tunisia, these woven, hand-finished, 100% Cotton Picnic Cloths are super soft, and only grow softer every time you wash them. Each package contains two 18-inch by 24-inch Cloths, perfectly sized for serving as a napkin, placemat, or serving cloth, which come in a gorgeous, gingham design and are available in three vibrant colors: a bright blue, a rich red, and a summer citrus-y yellow. And while we’re especially excited about their prospects at a picnic, cookout, or barbecue, they’re equally excellent as an everyday, all-purpose kitchen towel, too.

title: Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese
description: Our boxed Mac & Cheese is back! While we have numerous heat & eat, cheesy-mac options in our freezers every day, there’s something about boiling fresh pasta and stirring it together with butter, milk, and cheese that really stirs up one’s nostalgia. Trader Joe’s Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese rises to meet all of your childhood memories and more!Each box contains little tube-shaped Macaroni that you boil in a saucepan to your desired tenderness. We recommend 7-9 minutes. To the drained pasta, add 4 tablespoons of butter (we suggest salted), ¼ cup of milk, and the included cheese packet. The Cheddar Cheese seasoning blend creates a creamy, ultra-cheesy sauce to coat the tubes inside and out. And that classic orange color only comes naturally, from annatto and paprika.Trader Joe’s Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese is so good, just as it is. But you can also doctor it up, as you please. For an extra rich & tangy sauce, try mixing 1-2 tablespoons of Trader Joe’s Plain Greek Whole Milk Yogurt into the warm, drained pasta, just before adding the Cheese packet. Or add a couple squirts of TJ’s Sriracha Sauce for a little bit of heat. And why not make it a meal by crumbling in some cooked Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties? However you prepare our classic Mac & Cheese, it’s sure to satisfy the kids you know—including the kid in you!

title: Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit
description: Two summers back, we brought the proverbial boba shop home with the introduction of our everyday Instant Boba Kit, and it’s remained a hot ticket in our freezers ever since. So much so, in fact, that when approached by a Taiwanese supplier with an opportunity to offer a limited-time, more Tropical-tasting Boba Kit, we lept at the chance! You’ll be leaping, too, as soon as you get your hands on a Trader Joe’s Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit.For about the same price you’d pay for a single boba drink at a café, our Tropical Green Tea Boba Kit contains four pouches of vegan, gluten-free, tapioca pearls in a sweet, passion fruit & mango-flavored green tea syrup, plus four wide-gauge paper straws to help you capture some of said pearls in every sip. The Boba pearls only take a minute in the microwave to heat up; from there, it’s just a matter of placing them into the bottom of  a glass, adding ice, and pouring in your beverage of choice, like milk, green tea, coconut beverage, or even just cold water—anything goes! Then sit back, take a sip, and enjoy the sweet, refreshing, texturally satisfying ride.

title: Panzerotti Pizza Bites
description: What look like mini calzones, taste like cheese pizza, and eat like some of the tastiest hors d’oeuvres around? New Trader Joe’s Panzerotti Pizza Bites, that’s what!
