Made for us in Southern Italy by a supplier who specializes in this very appetizer, these two-to-three-bite-sized, lightly fried Pizza pockets take the concept of “after-school pizza rolls” and elevates it to flavorful new heights!Picture this: each Trader Joe’s Panzerotti Pizza Bite begins with a pleasantly chewy, half-moon-shaped pouch of pizza dough, which gets subsequently stuffed with a melty, mozzarella cheese blend and bold Italian tomato sauce, then quick-fried in vegetable oil. Simple? Yes. Simply irresistable? Also yes. Just heat them from frozen (we’re talking 12 minutes in a conventional oven, 8-10 minutes in an air fryer, or 1-2 minutes in a microwave here, folks—minimal effort), and you’ve got one delicious appetizer or snack on your hands... or rather, you’ve got several delicious Panzerotti Pizza Bites in your hands!

title: Pad See Ew
description: An indisputable icon of Thai restaurant menus and street food stalls the world over, pad see ew translates to “fried with soy sauce,” and was likely popularized within Thailand by Chinese immigrants in the early 20th century. A bit like a localized, Thai-cuisine-informed variation of chow fun (which was likely a direct inspiration), pad see ew is traditionally made with wide, flat rice noodles, which are fried in a wok with various veggies and garlic before being finished with a splash of light and dark soy sauce to give it a bold, savory, and umami-rich flavor. And that’s the same, time-tested technique that our supplier in Thailand uses when making Trader Joe’s Pad See Ew, a rich, flavorful, and totally vegan version of this classic dish that’s now available in our freezers.After mere minutes in the microwave, Trader Joe’s Pad See Ew makes an excellent work lunch, dinner entrée, or savory side dish. Every bite expresses a delightful depth of flavor, as well as a remarkable range of textures, from the tender chewiness of the noodles, to the snap of the carrots and Chinese broccoli, to the soft, tooth- sink-ability of the tofu chunks and tofu sheets. We recommend serving it alongside our (also vegan) Thai Green Curry, some fluffy jasmine rice, and a plate of stir-fried Baby Bok Choy.

title: Pulled Chicken Salsa Verde
description: In addition to developing foods with high-quality ingredients that are combined using exceptional recipes, we are also keen to develop Trader Joe’s products that are convenient, time-saving meal solutions for our customers. Trader Joe’s Pulled Chicken Salsa Verde is one of those products that checks all the boxes!Similar to Trader Joe’s Smoked Pulled Chicken, this Pulled Chicken recipe begins with seasoned, boneless, skinless Chicken breast. But here, the meat isn’t smoked. It’s seasoned with salt, white pepper, and garlic & onion powders, then slow-cooked in a Salsa Verde that includes roasted tomatillos, green chiles, cilantro, onion and garlic. The fully cooked meat is then shredded, so its really easy to tuck into tacos, burritos, quesadillas, or to pile on top of chips for nachos. And it’ll save you time on a busy weeknight, since all it takes to prepare is about four minutes in the microwave. Add a couple more minutes to that if you’d prefer to heat it in a saucepan on the stovetop. Either way, you’ll have a terrifically tender & flavorful protein you can use in a wide variety of simple, satisfying ways.

title: Kenya AA Karatu Small Lot Coffee
description: As one of the leading cultivators of some of the finest coffees in the world, the country of Kenya has a unique system of rating its coffee beans at point of harvest. At the top of this scale is the treasured “AA” grade, denoting beans with the largest size and most consistent shape of the entire crop. AA-rated coffee beans are renowned for their rich flavor profiles and dazzlingly deep aromas, and the newest addition to our Small Lot Coffee series is no exception. It’s brought to us by a collective of small farmers in Karatu, Kenya, who plant, harvest, and process these AA-rated beans entirely by hand, to ensure that every sip is superlatively smooth and satisfying.Once ground and brewed to your personal preferences, Trader Joe’s Kenya AA Karatu Small Lot Coffee makes a complex, yet balanced cup, with a bold, full body that’s complemented by a pleasantly citric acid structure. While it’s an excellent (albeit elevated) everyday kind of coffee, we find it serves especially well as part of a big breakfast or brunch: its bright notes of black currant and cacao make it a great pairing option with a flaky chocolate croissant, an auspicious eggs Benedict, or a tall stack of pancakes covered in fresh berries.

title: Bacon & Eggs Shaped Sweet Gummy Candies
description: If you thought breakfast for dinner was fun, wait until you try breakfast for dessert—talk about a walk on the wild side! That’s exactly what you’ll get with new, get-’em-while-we’ve-got-’em, available-for-a-limited-time- only Trader Joe’s Bacon & Eggs Shaped Sweet Gummy Candies.Our Bacon & Eggs Shaped Gummy Candies might look like small, sunny-side up eggs and little pieces of pink-ish bacon, but that’s about where the similarities end—because this batch of Bacon & Eggs is soft, chewy, and decidedlysweet, not savory. The “Bacon” pieces are cherry-flavored, the “Eggs” taste a bit like mango, and, unlike a real bacon & egg breakfast, there’s no pork involved—these Bacon & Eggs Shaped Gummy Candies are gelatin-free! How’s that for a sweet ‘n sizzling power couple?

title: Fresh Mozzarella Cheese Snackers
description: Maybe you enjoy Trader Joe’s String Cheese, or our Organic Light String Cheese. These individual sticks of milky mozzarella are a great option when you want a little protein boost, or are craving a bit of cheese. Now we’ve added another option to our family of handy cheese snacks: Trader Joe’s Fresh Mozzarella Cheese Snackers.These bite-size balls of fresh mozzarella are made from milk that’s freshly collected in the Treasure and Magic Valleys of southern Idaho; and it comes from cows that are not treated with rBST hormones. Making the Mozzarella involves microbial enzymes, which should please any cheese-loving vegetarians. The soft, yet reslient texture of the final product—with its creamy, milky flavor—should please anyone who loves good cheese!Each eight-ounce, resealable package contains eight, smaller, 70-calorie snack pouches that are ideally portioned for whenever that cheese craving creeps up. Enjoy the Fresh Mozzarella by itself and benefit from five grams of protein per pouch. Of course, you can always pair your pouch with other healthy snackables, such as Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes and Organic Cut and Peeled Carrots!

title: Double Chocolate Wafer Cookies
description: Wafer cookie enthusiasts might recall that, for years, we sold a certain branded chocolate wafer cookie in our stores. They were certainly delicious, but at Trader Joe’s, we’re all about kaizen—and we knew there was room for improvement. Now, many months and several versions later, we’re excited to introduce the chocolatey manifestation of our sweetest efforts: Trader Joe’s Double Chocolate Wafer Cookies.Made for us in Italy, these bite-sized, cubical Cookies contain four layers of a hazelnut-infused, chocolate cream filling sandwiched beteween delicate, crispy, cocoa wafers. They’re certainly simliar to those aforementioned branded chocolate wafers, but they’re even crispier and boast a richer, even more chocolatey flavor. They’re perfect as a small, sweet snack-on-the-go and/or an excellent companion to a cup of coffee or tea. You’ll find 8.8-ounce bags of Trader Joe’s Double Chocolate Wafer Cookies in our cookies & candy section.

title: Mango Cream Bars
description: Creamy, fruity, frozen bars are so fun and yummy for summer. Flavor-wise, these are a combination of creamy vanilla and sweet-tart mango. They're rich and creamy because the first ingredient is vanilla ice cream! And the fruity part is made with purée of both Magdalena and Alphonso mango varieties, delivering a tart & sweet, totally tropical taste!

title: Rainbow's End Trail Mix Bars
description: When we first introduced Trader Joe’s Rainbow’s End Trail Mix [sku 36825] to our shelves back in 2000, it truly set the bar for how sublimely simple a trail mix could be. With just a minimalist mix of peanuts, almonds, raisins, and candy-coated milk chocolate gems, every bite contains a remarkable medley of flavors and textures, which is why it’s remained a solid gold hit with our customers for nearly 25 years. So how does one celebrate such a bar-setting snack? How about by recontextualizing it into a new setting: a highly snackable Bar?Proudly made with the same constituent components as the Trail Mix that inspired it,  Trader Joe’s Rainbow’s End Trail Mix Bars are held together with a bit of tapioca syrup and a rich coating of dipped dark chocolate on the base. Like its predecessor, each Bar offers a nice mix of crunchiness from the roasted peanuts and almonds, a bit of tenderness from the plump raisins, and some fun, flavorful sweetness from the candy-coated milk chocolate, all of which is captivatingly complemented by the dark chocolate layer. We find it’s ideal for enjoying before work or school, during a hike or long car ride, or after a run or gym day.

title: Sliced Basil & Garlic Monterey Jack Cheese
description: Cool, mellow, and just a touch sweet, Monterey Jack is one of those cheeses that pretty much everyone can agree on—why, even its name makes it sound like a fundamentally friendly fellow. One of our favorite aspects of a good Monterey Jack is how well it serves as a canvas to other flavors—Pepper Jack being one of its most popular permutations. Which lead us to think: what other savory sensations might Monterey Jack mingle well with? That, in turn, lead to some epicurean experimentation, which happily lead to Trader Joe’s Sliced Garlic and Basil Monterey Jack Cheese.It’s crafted for us by an expert cheesemaker in Wisconsin, who infuses their Jack with rich, roasted Garlic purée and aromatic bits of Basil leaf before cutting it into sandwich-ready slices. Every bite is savory and satisfying, with a toothsome texture and a distinctly pesto-y herbaceousness that makes it especially great for grilled cheeses, patty melts, and delightfully deconstructed caprese salads and wraps. Try it on a burger, melted into an omelet, or, if you’d like a little complementary savory-sweet situation, over some freshly grilled, sliced stone fruit, and drizzled with Trader Joe’s Glaze.

title: Crispy Battered Calamari
description: There’s nothing like hitting the bar at happy hour and enjoying some fried appetizers and discounted drinks with friends, although... hitting the home “bar” with some appetizers from TJ’s has its perks. Besides not needing to leave your house, and saving money on tips, you also get the opportunity to enjoy tasty appetizers from our freezers, like Trader Joe’s Crispy Battered Calamari.We worked with seafood specialists in Italy to develop our own version of the classic ItalianAnelli alla Romana(“Roman Rings”). Our Calamari is made with squid rings and tentacles that are lightly battered with a combination of wheat flour, rice semolina, and baking soda. This helps develop a Crispy crunch during cooking in your conventional oven or air fryer. And they’re seasoned with salt, black pepper, garlic, onion, and chili pepper; just the right amount of flavor to enjoy as-is, or with a simple squeeze of fresh lemon juice.Of course, dipping these Crispy Battered squid into your favorite TJ’s sauce (we have so many!) adds yetanotherlayer of deliciousness. You’ll find 16-ounce packages of Trader Joe’s Crispy Battered Calamari every day in our freezers. Keep some inyourfreezer, for the next time you and your friends decide to have a happy hour at home.

title: Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties
description: When you read the words “juicy burger,” turkey is not likely the first meat that comes to mind—but what if it was? Our product developer set out to answer this very question while working to create summertime stars for grilling season (May to September, to be precise), and much to our tasting panel’s delight, he emerged victorious from the test kitchen with Trader Joe’s Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties.Made with 100% thigh meat, these grill-ready Turkey Patties are unbelievably—dare we sayimpossibly—juicy. The Caramelized Onion brings plenty of umami to the table, while the vegetal sweetness of the Bell Pepper deftly complements the savory Turkey in each tender bite. Thanks to their fuss-free prep and quick-cooking nature, you’ll have more time to ponder your preferred burger accoutrements (Brioche Bun? Sliced Swiss Cheese? Aioli Garlic Mustard Sauce? Yes, yes, andoh, yes!), as well as more time to bask in the glow of a relaxing summer’s evening. For a limited time, you’ll find this incredibly priced, grilling season must-have in the refrigerators at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s.

title: Norwegian Sourdough Rye Chips
description: In Scandinavia, rye has been a staple since at least the Middle Ages. But why rye? The key to rye’s rise lies in this grassy crop’s ability to flourish in a colder climate. It also had to do with rye’s dense, earthy, and pleasantly sour character when milled and used in baked goods. Trader Joe’s Norwegian Sourdough Rye Chips capitalize on rye’s goodness by delivering this dark, delicious grain in a crisp, seedy cracker.A bakery in Norway makes our Sourdough Rye Chips. First, they bake bread from a wheat and rye sourdough that includes whole-grain rye berries, sunflower seeds, and flax seeds. The bread is thinly sliced, fried in sunflower oil, and finished with a touch of salt. Each curved, irregularly shaped Chip has a super crunch that leads to nutty notes and rich rye flavor.We enjoy Trader Joe’s Norwegian Sourdough Rye Chips as a snack right out of the bag, but you can also use them to add crunch to your salad. And they’re strong enough for dipping into something savory, such as Chunky Artichoke Jalapeño Dip. For a more substantial snack, pair them with Oak Smoked Salmon Pieces and thin slices of Denmark Havarti.

title: Little Leaf Farms Baby Crispy Green Leaf
description: Since their founding in 2015, the folks at Little Leaf Farms® have been dedicated to the ideal of local, sustainable, and—most of all—delicious produce. From their greenhouse facilities in Massachusetts and Pennsylvania, they use recycled, UV-sanitized rainwater to cut their groundwater use by 90%, and recycled PET plastic for their packaging. They also proudly employ pesticide-free, herbicide-free, and even hands-free growing practices, so that when you open up a package of their Baby Crispy Green Leaf Lettuce, it’s totally ready to eat—no washing required.Now available in our East Coast stores, Little Leaf Farms® Baby Crispy Green Leaf Lettuce is just as tender and texturally satisfying as its name implies. Mild and delicately sweet, with a faint peppery note on the finish, these Leaves make an excellent (not to mention effortless) salad when tossed any of our dressings, like our Vegan Creamy Dill, Organic Italian, or French Vinaigrette with Shallots. We also find that their crisp, refreshing texture make them an able inclusion for all kinds of sandwiches, burgers, and wraps.

title: Oven Dried Red & Yellow Bell Pepper Crisps
description: Peter Piper was probably pleased when he picked a peck of pickled peppers. While we’d never throw shade at a nightshade inanyform, we’d like to posit that peckish Peter Piper would have beeneven morepleased had he picked up a peck—er, a bag—of Trader Oven Dried Red & Yellow Bell Pepper Crisps instead!Made for us in Turkey with three simple ingredients—red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, and sea salt—our Oven Dried Bell Pepper Crisps are an ideal anecdote to a sudden craving for some savory crunch, sans additives. Our supplier takes a 50/50 blend of fresh (not frozen) Bell Pepper slices, sprinkles them with sea salt, then dries (not fries) them in not one, buttwoseparate ovens. (Perhaps we should have gone withDoubleOven Dried?) The first pass through the oven prepares the peppers by slowly reducing their moisture levels, and the second dries them to peak crispiness. Snacks don’t get anymore straightforward than this...

title: Avocado Oil
description: It should come as no surprise that, here at Trader Joe’s, we’re avid advocates of avocado. And that’s true in all of avocados’ formidable forms, whether it’s mashed up in a flavorful guacamole, sliced up and adding crucial texture to a sandwich, or pressed into a lush, velvety Avocado Oil.Indeed, Trader Joe’s Avocado Oil carries the flavor and character of avocado. It’s a luxuriously smooth, velvety Oil is made from avocados grown Mexico, which offers an ideal avo-growing climate. This delicate, buttery oil is naturally high in monounsaturated fats (10 grams per serving), and with a roughly 500oF smoke point, it makes an excellent cooking oil. (For reference, olive oil has a smoke point closer to 350oF). Its clean, delicate flavor is a great match for all kinds of applications, from sautéing to baking to searing to garnishing.Avocado Oil is an excellent addition to your pantry and a good alternative to olive or other vegetable oils.

title: String Cheese
description: It’s no secret that kids love Trader Joe’s String Cheese. It may surprise you that adults are as smitten with this stringable snack as their progeny. Once you know Trader Joe’s String Cheese comes to us from a fourth generation, family-owned, Wisconsin cheese company, the love really starts to come into focus. And when you discover that the entire cheese making process – from fresh-from-the-farm milk (from cows raised without the use of rBST) to packed-and-ready-to-ship cheese – takes only about three hours, you will be so filled with love that you’re sure to find yourself with a craving for this mild, mozzarella-style cheese that’s portable and pulls apart with such ease.We think String Cheese is an excellent snack for anyone, really, whether you’re a kid or just a kid at heart – for a mid-morning pick-me-up, a boost before a workout or anytime at all.

title: Organic Chocolate Chip Baked Whole Grain Bar
description: Take a moment to consider the cereal bar with us, won’t you? Dependably delicious, and always there for you when you need a little pick-me-up, a good cereal bar can make the difference between a clear mind and a haze of hangriness. That’s one reason why we’re proud to add Trader Joe’s Organic Chocolate Chip Baked Whole Grain Bars to our already-estimable selection of cereal bars. Another reason? Each Bar combines the power of hearty oats, sweet fig paste, and rich chocolate chips to create a superlatively satisfying snacking experience.Delightfully dense, with a nice pop of chocolate in every bite, our gluten free and kosher Organic Chocolate Chip Baked Whole Grain Bars are ideal for enjoying on road trips, toting along on hikes, or packing in your gym bag for a little post-workout boost to your day. We also find that they’re phenomenally kid-friendly, excellent for bringing in backpacks as a pre-lunch snack, a post-lunch dessert, or an afterschool sweet treat. Whatever your situation, however your day is going, a Trader Joe’s Organic Chocolate Chip Baked Whole Grain Bar is certain to improve upon it—just as a good cereal bar ought to.

title: Organic Iced Oatmeal Baked Whole Grain Bar
description: Take a moment to consider the cereal bar with us, won’t you? Dependably delicious, and always there for you when you need a little pick-me-up, a good cereal bar can make the difference between a clear mind and a haze of hangriness. That’s one reason why we’re proud to add Trader Joe’s Organic Iced Oatmeal Baked Whole Grain Bars to our already-estimable selection of cereal bars. Another reason? Each Bar combines the power of hearty oats, sweet fig paste, and aromatic baking spice to create a superlatively satisfying snacking experience.Delightfully dense, with a nice element of vanilla-tinged sweetness in every bite, our gluten free and kosher Organic Iced Oatmeal Baked Whole Grain Bars are ideal for enjoying as a quick morning munch while commuting, or packing in your gym bag to bring a little post-workout boost to your day. We also find that they’re phenomenally kid-friendly, excellent for bringing in backpacks as a pre-lunch snack, a post-lunch dessert, or an afterschool sweet treat. Whatever your situation, however your day is going, a Trader Joe’s Organic Iced Oatmeal Baked Whole Grain Bar is certain improve upon it—just as a good cereal bar ought to.

title: Mini Shrimp Bao
description: Of all the various carbs and starches that the world’s cuisines have produced, we have to admit that we have a true soft spot for the bao bun—and for its soft and pillowy texture, in particular. That, combined with its mild, delicately savory, and just a touch sweet flavor, makes the bao bun an especially compelling conveyance for hearty proteins and aromatic sauces, as Trader Joe’s Mini Shrimp Bao rather deliciously demonstrate. Made for us by an expert supplier in Vietnam, each box contains eight miniature, clamshell-style Bao laden with a well-seasoned shrimp patty, as well as a sweet and sticky lemongrass, lime, and chili sauce for dipping.Excellent as an appetizer, hors d’oeuvre, or side dish, Trader Joe’s Mini Shrimp Bao offer a marvelous medley of complementary flavors and textures in every bite. Individually, each Bao takes less than a minute to microwave, and when prepped together, only a few minutes in the steamer before they’re tender, tasty, and ready to serve. They can be enjoyed as they are, right out of the box, or, if you prefer, dressed to your liking; we’re partial to garnishing each Bao with quick-pickled cucumber ribbons, shredded carrots, and freshly torn cilantro leaves.

title: Seafood Boil
description: In our estimation, nothing represents the very best aspects of Cajun cuisine better than a classic, Louisiana- style seafood boil. There’s the remarkable range of flavors, the ingenuity of ingredients, and, of course, the overall emphasis on community—what else can bring people together like a big batch of fiery-hot shellfish, after all? In honor of this storied (not to mention well-spiced) tradition, we’re bringing in Trader Joe’s Seafood Boil to our freezers. Each box contains a bag of shrimp, tilapia, clams, and andouille sausage, along with hearty corn on the cob and miniature potatoes, all pre-seasoned with a lip-smackingly spicy garlic butter sauce.Ça c’est bon, non?Once home, your Trader Joe’s Seafood Boil can be conveniently prepped by either boiling it all in-bag, or by placing the contents of the bag in a sauce pan and heating until cooked through. Either way, in about 20- 25 minutes, you’ll have a spicy, buttery, Cajun-style seafood and veggie medley ready to be served. It makes an excellent and practically effortless weeknight dinner option, especially considering each bag contains two hearty servings. We recommend pairing your Seafood Boil with an Everyday Butter Lettuce Salad and some white rice or crusty bread to soak up as much of that garlicky, buttery sauce as you can.

title: Slow Roasted Tomatoes
description: While there’s nothing like biting into a fresh, homegrown tomato at the height of the season, the height of the season comes but once a year. Thankfully, there’s no need to settle for subpar when seeking sun-soaked tomato flavor—simply reach for a jar of Trader Joe’s Slow Roasted Tomatoes.These Tomatoes come to us from a fourth-generation tomato processor in Turkey. (Fun fact: Turkey is the third- largest tomato-producing country in the world!). They bring firm, vibrantly colored, field-grown tomatoes into their solar-powered facility, where they Slow Roast them for eight hours. This process intensifies their inherently bright and tangy flavors and yields a tender, soft-dried texture that falls somewhere between a fresh Roma and a classic sun-dried tomato. Marinated in a combination of sunflower and extra virgin olive oils with a touch of garlic and oregano, the scarlet Slow Roasted Tomatoes boast an irresistible, umami-infused quality and sun-soaked tomato flavor that rival their fresh counterparts.Ideal for topping salads and sandwiches or serving on a cheese board with TJ’s Chevre, you might even stir a few Slow Roasted Tomatoes into a bowl of Cottage Cheese with freshly ground black pepper for a quick snack.

title: Spicy Tempura Seaweed Snack
description: Light, crispy, and utterly abounding with umami, roasted seaweed is perhaps as close to perfect as a snack food can get. But even that level of near-perfection can be improved upon, especially when that improvement involves a dash of spicy, savory seasoning and a crunchy tempura coat. Need proof? Look no further than Trader Joe’s Spicy Tempura Seaweed Snack! It’s made for us by a supplier in Thailand, who takes sheets of nori harvested from a seaweed farm in Korea, dips them in savory, starchy tempura batter and fries them until they’re superlatively crisp, then finishes them off with a fiery, togarashi-inspired seasoning blend. Each and every bite is crunchy, spicy, bursting with savory flavor, and, somehow, better than the last.Trader Joe’s Spicy Tempura Seaweed Snack can be enjoyed totally on its own, as a companion to sports spectation, movie marathoning, or any other occasion that calls for something satisfyingly crunchy. It also makes a remarkably apt chip for scooping up all kinds of savory dips, and lends a tremendous pop of texture when crumbled over salads, soups, and rice bowls.

title: Aperito Spritz
description: When the weather warms, a nice, spritzy cocktail is nothing short of heavenly. When you’re winding down after a long, hot day, or kicking up your feet on a warm porch or patio, a bubbly little beverage hits like nothing else. That’s why we’re so excited to bring Aperito Spritz to our shelves. Crafted for us with a base of lightly bubbly wine that’s been spruced up with natural orange and aromatic herbal flavors, every sip of this Spritz is fruity and slightly sweet, with a beautifully bitter and bracing edge.Bright and refreshing, with just enough herbaceous astringency to slyly stimulate the senses, our Aperito Spritz makes a capable companion to pool-side lounging, afternoons outside, or any other summery scenario you can imagine. Best served well chilled (and accessorized with a wedge of orange, if you’d like), we find it pairs particularly well with charcuterie and tart, creamy chevres, like our very own Goat Cheese.

title: Key Lime Tea Cookies
description: As spring makes way for summer, Trader Joe’s Key Lime Tea Cookies make their way to our cookie shelves once more. These bite-sized delights measure just over an inch in diameter, so there is only room for the essentials: powdered sugar, flour, butter, key lime powder (made from dehydrated lime juice), and natural key lime flavor—nothing extra (read: no artificial flavors here!). It’s like you baked them at home, except… you did not bake them at home, so you and your kitchen can remain cool on hot summer days.The sublime, sweet-tart flavor and crumbly texture of these Key Lime-infused Cookies make them excellent companions to velvety vanilla ice cream—mini ice cream sandwiches, anyone? In keeping with the tropical theme, you could enjoy them at teatime with Mango Black Tea, Fresh-Cut Pineapple, and Apricot Mango Greek Yogurt. Of course, they’re easily enjoyed right out of the box, by the handful (be sure to have a napkin nearby!).

title: Ciabatta Baguette
description: Ciabatta and baguette? Before now, you might have thought that ciabatta is ciabatta and a baguette is a baguette. But why can’t we have the best of both worlds? What if ciabatta was a baguette? And this baguette had all the enchanting qualities of ciabatta? Cue Trader Joe’s Ciabatta Baguette, the best of both bread worlds.The loaf is in the shape of a baguette (meaning “wand” in Italian), but the bread itself is ciabatta bread. Ciabatta dough contains a higher moisture content than traditional baguette dough—over 70% in this case—giving it a thin, slightly caramelized crust and a light crumb with large holes. Better yet, it’s made with just a few in- gredients: unbleached wheat flour, water, sea salt, yeast, and malted barley. Though our supplier makes large quantities of bread, they are still able to achieve the sought-after artisanal taste and texture. And, really, what’s more artisan than the uniting of two esteemed artisan breads?Slice as you would a baguette and dip to your heart’s content, preferably in Sicilian Selezione Extra Virgin Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar of Modena. It also makes an excellent panini. Or, go the traditional route: use it to soak up extra sauce from a heaping bowl of spaghetti—ciabatta is famous for its ability to be dipped without falling apart. For a bit more crunch, place the bread in a 400˚F oven for a few minutes.

title: Ciabatta Demi-Baguette
description: Ciabatta and baguette? Before now, you might have thought that ciabatta is ciabatta and a baguette is a baguette. But why can’t we have the best of both worlds? What if ciabatta was a baguette? And this baguette had all the enchanting qualities of ciabatta? Cue Trader Joe’s Ciabatta Demi-Baguette, the best of both bread worlds.The loaf is in the shape of a half baguette (“demi-” and “wand” in Italian), but the bread itself is ciabatta bread. Ciabatta dough contains a higher moisture content than traditional baguette dough—over 70% in this case— giving it a thin, slightly caramelized crust and a light crumb with large holes. Better yet, it’s made with just a few ingredients: unbleached wheat flour, water, sea salt, yeast, and malted barley. Though our supplier makes large quantities of bread, they are still able to achieve the sought-after artisanal taste and texture. And, really, what’s more artisan than the uniting of two esteemed artisan breads?Slice as you would a baguette of any size and dip to your heart’s content, perhaps in Sicilian Selezione Extra Virgin Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar of Modena. Or, go the traditional route: use it to soak up extra sauce from a heaping bowl of spaghetti—ciabatta is famous for its ability to be dipped without falling apart. For a bit more crunch, place the bread in a 400˚F oven for a few minutes.

title: Pronto! Amaro Aperitivo
description: If you’re in the mood for a refreshing, aromatic Aperitivo, then you’re in luck, because Trader Joe’s can get you one—Pronto! If you’re in need of a mixer for making complex, flavorful cocktails, the Trader Joe’s spirits section will have just the thing—Pronto! And if you’re just dying to try that trendy, spritzy drink you’ve seen all over social media, and need an Italian herbal liqueur to base it around, Trader Joe’s can hook you up—Pronto! Trader Joe’s Pronto! Amaro Aperitivo, to be specific! It’s made especially for us by a distiller in Italy, who infuses each batch with alluringly aromatic herbs and zesty orange peel to create a flavor profile that’s bracingly bitter, yet eminently easy-drinking.As a pre-meal Apertivo, Pronto! can be enjoyed entirely on its own, served neat or on the rocks, though we find that a squeeze of lemon or orange helps bring the best out of its herbaceous attributes. As a cocktail ingredient, it’s an essential element of a Negroni, Paper Plane, or Black Manhattan, and makes a superb substitute for vermouth for those looking to try a new take on their old favorites. And, of course, if you’ve got your sights on a classic Amaro spritz, you can’t go wrong mixing three parts sparkling wine, two parts Pronto!, and one part soda water.

title: Grecian Style Eggplant with Tomatoes & Onions
description: Trader Joe's Grecian Style Eggplant with Tomatoes & Onions is an unexpected delicacy. Upon tasting it, we were enchanted by the soft, melt-in-your-mouth texture and the smooth, almost squash-like eggplant flavor that came to life amidst the bright, savory-sweetness of the tomatoes and onions. Our tasting panel was taken by surprise—these wondrous, not-at-all-bitter eggplants really came from a can? Really? Really.Grecian Style Eggplant with Tomatoes & Onions is made for us in Bulgaria, where the eggplant is grown, by our famed Greek Dolmas producers. (They have a production facility in that Southeastern European country, so the eggplant can be cooked immediately upon harvest from the fields.) Whole, long, narrow eggplants—har- vested at the height of the season—are split in half lengthwise and stewed in a rich, flavorful “sauce” of tomatoes and onions. Seasoned with parsley, garlic, red pepper and curry powder, and canned with soy oil, the gently- flavored, purple fruits of the nightshade family blossom with seductive, Mediterranean essence.The eggplant halves unfurl from the can, impressively intact. Place them on a plate for a ready-to-enjoy (room temp or warmed) edible. Serve them as a side to roasted lamb and rice, or as a salad with fresh green bell peppers and feta. Broil with a little cheese and coarsely chop to create a delicious and unique pasta topping.

title: Burrata Filling
description: Nearly everyone who’s experienced it enjoys that moment when the Burrata ball is sliced open to reveal luscious cream loaded with shreds of fresh mozzarella. But not everyone knows that this coveted Burrata Filling is actually an Italian cheese on its own, known as Stracciatella. For a limited time, you can now buy Trader Joe’s Stracciatella Burrata Filling to bring cheesy, Italian flair to your summer entrées and side dishes.Our Stracciatella is richly textured and mildly sweet, which makes it ideal for pairing with acidic flavors, like tomatoes. It’s also eminently spreadable, well-suited for topping bruschetta, or a piece of toasted Olive Fougasse. Drop dollops of Burrata Filling on your hot-from-the-oven pizza, or plate of pasta primavera. Of course, our Stracciatella also makes a great addition to a crisp green salad, drizzled with balsamic vinegar. And if you simply want to enjoy the unique character of this cheese like the Italians do, try eating it straight out of a bowl with a spoon. For a limited time, you’ll find tubs of Trader Joe’s Stracciatella Burrata Filling in our refrigerators among our multiple, molto bene, mozzarella varieties.

title: Peaches + Cream Cream Cheese Spread
description: If you are a peach appreciator, trying to incorporate this fruit into just about every meal doesn’t seem unreasonable. In fact, the peach’s sweet, sun-kissed flavor and blink-and-you’ll-miss-it seasonality practically demand it! It’s with this ardent admiration and devotion to experimentation in mind that we bring you Trader Joe’s Peaches & Cream Cream Cheese Spread, a limited-edition addition to our refrigerators.As you might expect, delicate chunks of Peaches dot the base of this pleasantly tangy Cream Cheese Spread. Its bright, fruit stand-inspired flavor is tailor-made for quick bagel breakfasts, brunch buffets, and summer cheese boards. You might spread it on a turkey sandwich for a sweet-n-savory vibe, or swipe a spoonful across a slice of banana bread—even better, swirl a few dollops into a pan of banana bread batter before baking. Gilding the lily? Maybe. Delicious? You bet!

title: Organic Freezer Pops
description: Remember back when you were a kid, and one of the coolest ways to cool down was to grab an ice-cold freezer pop? As it turns out, that’s still one of the coolest ways to cool down, which is why we’re bringing Trader Joe’s Organic Freezer Pops to our shelves! Just like the classic, fruity freezer pops you grew up with, ours arrive at the store in a shelf-stable package and only need to be frozen overnight before they’re ready to enjoy. Unlike those freezer pops of the past, however, ours are certified Organic and contain 100% juice!Inside each package, you’ll find ten Pops in three fantastic flavors: three sweet and citric Orange Pops, three rich and refreshing Berry Pops, and four tart and tangy Cherry Limeade Pops. An excellent anytime sweet treat for kids and adults alike, Trader Joe’s Organic Freezer Pops make an especially nice bit of refreshment for enjoying after school, sports practices, and other outdoor activities. Once you take them home, we recommend giving them a quick shake before freezing—since they’re made with real fruit juice concentrates, this will help reduce any natural separation that may occur as the juices inside each Pop settle.

title: Surf's Pup Dog Treats
description: Cue the “Wipe Out” drums and the “Walk Don’t Run” guitar lick... it’s time to paw-ty! Let all the dogs out, ‘cause it’s time to treat the TJ’s way, with Trader Joe’s Surf ’s Pup Dog Treats.Of our many marvelous doggie-treat offerings, these just may be the most Trader Joe’s specific. The box with the surfing Pup contains a collection of treats that come in four distinct, surf-themed shapes: Ruff-riffic Hawaiian Shirt, Flippity Floppity (a flip-flop), Hibiscus Blossom, and TJ Shortboard. Beyond these surf-themed shapes that recall some aspect of your neighborhood store décor, the ingredients in these Treats are true to our TJ’s food-quality standards. The crunchy, whole wheat flour-based biscuits contain no animal by-products and are naturally colored by annatto extract.Best of all, the recipe includes a combination of pork, sweet potato, and ground coconut. The subtle coconut aroma leads to a savory & sweet flavor that your Pups will definitely enjoy, whether as a between-meal snack or a training reward. The 10.6-ounce box of Trader Joe’s Surf ’s Pup Dog Treats might even help you coax them up on the board after all!

title: Hydrating Biocellulose Face Mask
description: With summer on the horizon and sunny skies ahead, now is the time to seize that summer glow—and there’s no better way to get glowing than with a Trader Joe’s Hydrating Biocellulose Face Mask! Single-use sheet Masks are still all the rage in the world of at-home skin care, and ours is truly top of the line.For starters, whereas most sheet masks are made from cotton, this one is made from coconut fiber-derived Biocellulose—a thinner, lab-produced material that can retain up to four times more fluid than its cotton counterpart. This allows the Mask to contour and adhere to your face more securely, bringing even more of its Hydrating serum in contact with your skin. This, you’ll find, is a very good thing, because the serum we’ve selected for our Biocellulose Face Mask is something special; the Mask comes soaked in blend of Hydrating hyaluronic acid and aloe, skin-brightening vitamin C and turmeric root extract, calming cocoa and camelia leaf extracts, and a bevy of other botanicals. (Plus a light, cucumber-y scent to give it some extra spauthenticity.) Best of all, our incredible price for each Face Mask means you can make every day a spa day!

title: Yuzu Kosho
description: The trick behind many great hot sauces and spicy condiments is a balance between tartness and heat—in a classic Buffalo sauce, for example, this is most often achieved via a carefully calibrated ratio of vinegar to cayenne. However, in the case of yuzu kosho, a chili paste popular in Japanese cuisine, it’s less of a balancing act and more of a gleeful deep dive into both ends of the spectrum. Made with a captivating combination of chili peppers, sea salt, and peel of yuzu (a citrus that’s downright essential in Japanese cuisine), Trader Joe’s Yuzu Kosho offers thrilling heat, invigorating zestiness, and even a touch of umami in every bracing bite.Our Yuzu Kosho’s savory, sour, and spicy notes make it a more-than-capable condiment for all kinds of applications: it’s an excellent spread for a sandwich, a terrific topper for freshly-seared scallops, and a superb sauce for spicing up a slice of pizza. Try mixing it into your next marinade for barbecued chicken wings, or adding a spoonful to a salad dressing for a little extra oomph. And for a truly special dip for French fries, Tots, and Organic Chicken Nuggets, add a bit of Yuzu Kosho to a small bowl of mayonnaise and sprinkle with Furikake.

title: Strawberries & Crème Pancake & Waffle Mix
description: Just in time for the start of summer, Trader Joe’s has Strawberries & Crème Pancake & Waffle Mix! We could have stopped right there, but we would have missed an opportunity to sing the praises of these fabulous, fruit- forward flapjacks. The Mix is replete with sweetened dried strawberry pieces, exuding the bright, bold flavor of this iconic berry; the addition of white chocolatey chips lends a pleasantly sweet and creamy counterpoint. When combined with milk, eggs, and oil, the Mix takes on a beautifully blushy hue (courtesy of vegetable juices!), and the included buttermilk powder ensures the expected amount of height and fluffiness in every swoon-worthy batch of Pancakes or Waffles.Lazy mornings are exponentially improved with a stack of Strawberries & Crème Pancakes (or an impressive pile of minis) topped with butter and maple syrup. And don’t discount the ease and appeal of a sweet-savory, breakfast-for-dinner situation—fried chicken & Strawberries & Crème Waffle sandwiches, anyone? We’ve seen similar, “gourmet” pancake mixes on the market with a gourmet price tag to match (and without strawberry pieces!), and nothing stacks up to our incredible price. You’ll find Strawberries & Crème Pancake & Waffle Mix on the grocery shelves at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, while our supplies last.

title: Organic Tart Cherry Fruit Spread
description: We cannot tell a lie: we love cherry preserves, especially during the spring. That’s why we’re so excited to offer Trader Joe’s Organic Tart Cherry Fruit Spread during this time of year. It’s made for us with a simple recipe of tart and tangy Organic Turkish Sour Cherries, organic sugar, pectin, and citric acid, so that every jar is a genuine jubilee of pure, sweet and sour cherry flavor.As you might expect, our Organic Tart Cherry Fruit Spread is terrific on morning toasts and muffins (especially when combined with a spread of our Cultured Salted Butter), but that’s hardly where we’d stop with this stupendous Spread. We recommend serving it alongside your favorite cheeses as part of a charcuterie platter (it’s particularly delicious with chevres, bries, and burratas), mixing it into marinades for steak, ribs, or chicken, and layering into tantalizingly tart parfaits. And for an easy, yet elevated, work or school lunch, it makes a uniquely delicious PB&J sandwich.

title: Mango Mochi
description: With the perennial popularity of our ice cream Mochi and all things Mango (see TJ’s Soft & Juicy Mango, TJ’s Mango Cream Bars, et al.), one might argue that the development of Trader Joe’s Mango Mochi was… well, inevitable. And you wouldn’t be wrong—our Buyer had Mango on her mind from the moment she was charged with the task of creating our next, limited-edition Mochi flavor.Like our everyday Mochi options (Vanilla, Green Tea, & Strawberry), Trader Joe’s Mango Mochi are essentially one-or-two-bite-sized scoops of sweet-tart Mango ice cream, surrounded by soft, chewy Mochi rice wrappers. While these frozen delicacies might be small, they pack a whole lot of mango flavor. Heck, the ice cream itself contains more than 20% alphonso mango purée—talk about tropical treats!

title: Lemon Ginger Cheesecake
description: Just between us, dear reader: you work hard. You do! You clearly care about the kind of food you eat and feed to your loved ones, otherwise you wouldn’t be reading this page. If you don’t mind us saying so, you deserve something sweet and delicious. Honestly, you deserve to treat yourself to a Trader Joe’s Lemon Ginger Cheesecake. With everything you do, you should absolutely take the time to savor every bite of this Cheesecake’s tantalizingly tart cream cheese base, flavored with lemon curd and actual bits of lemon peel, as well as its dense, crumbly, gingersnap crust.Lemon Ginger Cheesecake is an excellent dessert option for bringing along to cookouts, serving to friends at the end of weekend brunches, or simply enjoying as an anytime reward for being the kind of dedicated, determined person you are. “Now, now,” you might be saying, “surely, such a rich and decadent Cheesecake comes with an equally extravagant price tag.” While that’s an utterly understandable sentiment, each seven- inch-diameter, 30-ounce Trader Joe’s Lemon Ginger Cheesecake sells for about the same price you’d pay for a single slice of cheesecake at a bakery or restaurant, making it an eminently affordable indulgence. Stop by your Trader Joe’s freezer section to pick one up while supplies last. You deserve it!

title: Blueberry Elderflower Beverage
description: Certain drinks indelibly evoke a specific time of year, like hot cocoa for the winter, apple cider for the fall, and ice-cold lemonade for the summer. With Trader Joe’s Blueberry Elderflower Beverage, we wanted to create a drink that called to mind not just the feeling of springtime, but the very essence of it as well. We started with refreshing blueberry purée to provide a fruity, flavorful foundation, sweetened it with sugar, then added natural elderflower flavor for some enchantingly aromatic floral notes. This combo, along with a bit of lime juice for balancing acidity, give every sip the sensation of being in a field of flowers in full spring bloom.Our Blueberry Elderflower Beverage is best served chilled or over ice, preferably while relaxing in late spring or early summer splendor. It makes an excellent accompaniment to a sunny weekend brunch, a picnic in the park, or a lazy day spent lounging by the pool. We also find that it makes a marvelous mixer for all kinds of spirits, and especially those with similarly botanical sensibilities, like our Art of the Still Gin.

title: Everything but the Bagel Cheddar Cheese
description: Every now and then, we introduce a product that attains a kind of instantaneous iconic status. Our Everything But the Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend definitely falls into that category. Since its debut back in 2017, it has remained perennially popular, and it’s easy to see why: it turns out that garlic, onion, poppy, sesame, and sea salt synergize with a whole lot more than just bagels. Take, for instance, this new addition to our cheese section, Trader Joe’s Everything But the Bagel Cheddar Cheese. It’s crafted just for us by an expert cheesemaker, who infuses each wheel with the very same seasoning we sell on our shelves, so that each bite is rich with the maximalist mix of aromatic alliums, crunchy seeds, and savory spice you know and love.In addition to making an excellent cheese to simply snack upon, we find that these pops of flavor and texture also make this bold and tangy Cheddar a great choice for a grilled cheese or macaroni bake, or slicing and serving atop a nice burger on a Brioche Bun. Try it on your next cheese board or charcuterie spread the next time you have company over. And if you feel like bringing everything full circle, try melting a slice over a toasted bagel with a fried egg and bacon for an unbeatable breakfast sandwich.

title: Passion Fruit Granola
description: Is your morning routine feeling a little… uninspired? Does your plain granola leave you longing for more? Look no further than Trader Joe’s Passion Fruit Granola! These sweet, tropical-tasting clusters will ignite a brand- new passion for breakfast and set your snacking spirits soaring. You might even say that granola got its groove back—if it ever left at all.Made from a base of rolled oats and cane sugar, this otherwise simple Granola gets its punch and pizzaz from real Passion Fruit purée and bits of sweet-tart, freeze-dried raspberries. You can munch on these clusters straight out of the bag, or you can enjoy them with milk, in lieu of your tired breakfast routine. You could also double the passion by sprinkling some Passion Fruit Granola on top of our Guava Passion Fruit Greek Yogurt!

title: Strawberry Yogurt Flavored Coated Almonds
description: The flavor of strawberries is among the most beloved tastes of early summer. Being stalwart strawberry supporters ourselves, we’re bursting with strawberry-inspired selections in our stores right now, like TJ’s Organic Strawberry Lemonade, TJ’s Strawberry Overnight Oats, TJ’s Strawberries & Crème Pancake & Waffle Mix... and now, Trader Joe’s Strawberry Yogurt Almonds, too!Our supplier roasts their high-quality Almonds in-house, then enrobes them in a light layer of creamy, strawberry yogurt-flavored coating. (This lighter coating was very intentional, to make these Strawberry Yogurt Almonds more snackable.) Finally, they’re finished with a delicious dusting of strawberry powder made from crushed, freeze-dried strawberries. Smell the fruity aroma as you lift one to your mouth, then taste the sweet-tart yogurt and distinct flavor of strawberries as you crunch into each Almond. Are they nuts, or are they candy? The answer is simply... Yes!

title: Super Strawberry Sorbet
description: We didn’t just name our brand-new sorbet flavor “Super Strawberry Sorbet,” for the alliteration. (Although, it is fun to say.) In fact, we called it super because we think that’s the best word to describe Trader Joe’s latest, fruity, frozen treat! Even beyond the “super-fruit” status of strawberries, this Sorbet has other superb qualities going for it. Our supplier in Thailand starts with locally harvested strawberries that have a balanced, sweet & tart flavor, which translates sensationally when blended with water & cane sugar to form the smooth Sorbet base. Then, they add Strawberry pieces to amp up the texture and augment the Super Strawberry flavor.We’re confident that anyone who gets their hands on (and their spoons in) Trader Joe’s Super Strawberry Sorbet is going to love it. In particular, those who avoid animal products will definitely be assigning superlatives to this vegan dessert. But you can’t love it if you never try it...

title: Danish Princess Pastry
description: When the weather heats up and turning on the oven loses its luster, you can still quell a craving for carbs with a visit to the bakery section at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s. You’ll find everyday staples like sliced breads, bagels, and tortillas, along with a seasonally rotating selection of muffins, cookies, and pastries—all for a fraction of the prices you might find elsewhere. Case in point: Trader Joe’s Danish Princess Pastry.Not to be confused with the Swedish sponge cake bearing the same name (who knew so many sweets were marked with this royal moniker?), Trader Joe’s Danish Princess Pastry is made for us in Denmark, constructed of classic, tender pastry dough cradling a creamy, custard style, persipan-infused filling. (Fun fact: persipan is an aromatic confectionary ingredient used in baking, and as you might guess, akin to marzipan, but made with apricot kernels instead of almonds.) Rather than a single-serve round, this Danish is formed into an easy-to- slice rectangle that can easily feed a crowd, and with a just-about-even ratio of pastry to filling, it’s equally at home on a breakfast buffet or dessert platter. It can be enjoyed right out of the package, and if you can stand the heat, a 2-to-4-minute stint in the oven truly takes it over the top. Whether you enjoy your Pastry warm or cold, do as the Danes do and complement it with a strong, dark cup of coffee, like TJ’s French Roast [sku 77083].

title: Beef Rib Eye Steak
description: At Trader Joe’s, our buyers travel the world in search of the best quality products at the best everyday prices for our customers. This commitment to value is evident across our offerings in general, and with Trader Joe’s Ribeye Steak, in particular.This 100% Angus beef comes to us from Argentina and Brazil, regions renowned for producing some of the highest quality beef in the world. The steers’ primary diet is supplied by the lush, low-lying grasslands of the South American Pampas, and is rounded out with corn and grain to impart the desired marbling in this boneless cut. Because marbling equals fat, and fat equals flavor, it follows that the quality of the finished Ribeye Steak boasts truly melt-in-your-mouth flavor, on par with anything you’d find in an Argentinian or Brazilian steakhouse— minus the steakhouse price tag, of course.

title: Lemon Herb Macaroni Salad
description: Modeled after a popular modern take on the classic recipe, Trader Joe’s Lemon Herb Macaroni Salad is not your grandmother’s mac. Of course, semolina elbow Macaroni anchors our chilled Salad in nostalgia, and the dressing mimics the creamy, mayo-based version of the past. Beyond these familiarities, though, the recipe departs for a new era, going lighter on the mayo and incorporating buttermilk, which hints at a tanginess that arrives in full with a cucumber, celery, and caper relish in a vinegar, white wine, and lemon juice brine.The inclusion of zest locks in the Lemon profile promised in the name, while the Herb component is distinctly dill-forward, partnering with parsley and a host of spices and aromatics. Harkening back to your grandma’s recipe, wehaveincluded a touch of sugar (less than one gram of added sugar per serving), which lends a final balance to the zestier components.

title: Vidalia Onions
description: “Onion,luminous flask,your beauty formedpetal by petal...”-Pablo Neruda,Ode to the OnionIt would be difficult to overstate just how important onions are to global cuisine. Nearly every culinary tradition the world over relies on onions in some form or another, and they often serve as the very bedrock of flavor that dishes are built upon. Noted for their sweetness, Vidalia Onions are a particularly essential allium, which is why we’re proud to offer them in convenient, two-pound bags during the spring and summer months.Grown for us in the state of Georgia, where only 20 counties are legally allowed to cultivate and call this particular variant Vidalia (and where the Vidalia Onion is the state vegetable, in fact!), our Vidalias can be used in any application that calls for an onion. We find, however, that they’re particularly great for roasting, caramelizing, and quick-pickling—all of which will accentuate their natural sweetness. Raw, they’re excellent for topping sandwiches, burgers, and hot dogs, and make an awesome ingredient for salads, salsas, and skewers. For an easy, out-of-this-world confit, try cooking them low and slow in a skillet with butter, sugar, and a touch of red wine until they reach a super dark, golden brown.

title: Vignobles Lacheteau Touraine Sauvignon Blanc
description: The Loire Valley, south of Paris and about in the middle of France, is known widely for its wine production— most notably, white wines. Sauvignon Blanc from the sub-region of Sancerre is perhaps this Valley’s most famous white. But while Sancerre may be the most well-known and prestigious white-wine provenance in the region, there’s another sub-region called Touraine that produces comparable whites. And Touraine is where Vignobles Lacheteau Sauvignon Blanc originates.Vignobles Lacheteau Touraine Sauvignon Blanc is, indeed, composed of 100% Sauvignon Blanc grapes, and is fermented in stainless steel tanks to preserve its fresh flavor profile and vibrant character. It’s deeply aromatic, with bright notes of citrus and spring blossoms, tasters will note a pronounced, yet balanced, acidity that keeps the palate engaged with every scintillating sip. Drink it chilled, on its own, or enjoy a glass with a green salad with Goat Cheese and French Vinaigrette with Shallots. You may find it pairs surprisingly well with a grilled Sweet Italian Sausage, too.

title: Cinsault Rosé Maison Barboulot
description: If you frequent the wine section at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, you’ve likely come across Maison Barboulot Cabernet Syrah [sku 62771]. (And if you haven’t visited the wine section lately, come say hi! Our Crew are friendly, knowledgeable, and would love to tell you about their favorites). This one-time hidden gem is now a solid customer favorite, thanks to its amazing quality and equally excellent price. So, when our buyer came across a rosé from the same region in France, with the same quality-to-price characteristics, we jumped at the chance to bring it into stores. Just in time for summer, give it up for Maison Barboulot Cinsault Rosé!If you were sitting at a sidewalk café in France, this is likely what you’d find in your glass come happy hour. It’s made from 100% Cinsault (pronounced “SAN-soh”) grapes, grown among the morning mists and Mediterranean sea breezes of the Pays d’Oc region. Those growing conditions contribute to the wine’s artful balance of floral and fruity notes and its dry and refreshing nature, as well as its light and lively palate that plays well with baked salmon, pesto chicken, or a citrus-y pasta salad. We’re delighted to say: Rosé is here to stay!

title: Sparkling Guava Juice Beverage
description: Made with 50% guava juice and plenty of bubbles, Trader Joe’s Sparkling Guava Juice Beverage sips like a sweet, tropical daydream on a warm, sunny day. It’s a perfect pick for picnics, great for packing in lunches, and can even satisfy a sudden craving for something sweet.Enjoy it chilled, served straight from the can or over ice. Add it to a cocktail or mocktail, garnished with a fresh strawberry and one of those fancy little paper umbrellas. Make it the base of a fruity float, or an ice cream soda made with TJ’s Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream. Trust us, you’ve guava try it!

title: Wild Caught Boneless Grilled Sardines in Olive Oil
description: In recent years, tinned fish has undergone what can only be described as a full-on reputational renaissance— and if you ask us, it’s about time! We’re doing our part to promote this resurgence in piscine appreciation with the introduction of Trader Joe’s Grilled Sardines in Olive Oil. They’re wild-caught for us off the coast of Tunisia, then their fillets are split down the middle and lightly grilled before being stacked and packed in olive oil. Out of the tin, each gloriously grill-marked Sardine is firm and meaty in texture, with a savory and delicately smoky flavor, ideal for enjoying as a protein for a quick meal, as part of an hors d’oeuvre spread, or as a hearty, anytime snack.A must-have for any sea-cuterie board, these boneless Grilled Sardines pair well with all kinds of cheeses, pickles, and olives. They’re also excellent atop toasts, pastas, salads, and pizzas, and act as a first-rate filling for sandwiches, too—we find that their faint smokiness makes them an especially apt choice for a pescatarian bánh mi. And for a simple, satisfying snack, try serving a half-fillet on a cracker or crostini with a touch of TJ’s Garlic Spread-Dip and a squirt of lemon juice.

title: French Vinaigrette with Shallots
description: A great salad dressing should accomplish three things: for starters, it shouldn’t be too thick—at that point, it’s just dip. Second, it should expertly complement your salad ingredients. And third, it should of course, be delicious. We’re delighted to report that Trader Joe’s French Vinaigrette with Shallots handily meets these salad dressing standards.Sporting a signature tanginess courtesy of red wine vinegar and Dijon mustard, this French Vinaigrette with Shallots offers from-scratch flavor without the hassle that tends to accompany from-scratch preparation. Its subtle, sophisticated flavors and easily poured nature create a classic Paris bistro vibe wherever you splash it—on Little Gem Lettuce, in a marinade for chicken or fish, over of-the-moment veggies (think steamed Artichokes or grilled Zucchini), or in a picnic-ready pasta salad. (Give the bottle a good shake prior to use—just like a from-scratch dressing, you won’t find gums or thickeners here!)This authentic, made-in-France classic is an astonishing value—and now available on the grocery shelves at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, every day.

title: Coconut Chickpea Curry
description: Within the vast spectrum of culinary traditions and regional specialties that fit under the umbrella of Indian cuisine, we find that one through line tends to connect them all: a masterful balance of flavors, textures, and aromas. That’s certainly the first thing our tasting panel noticed about Trader Joe’s Coconut Chickpea Curry, the latest addition to our collection of Indian Fare pouches. Made with a relatively simple recipe that includes coconut milk, chickpeas, chopped veggies, and spices like turmeric, cinnamon oil, and dried curry leaves, this heat-and-eat Curry achieves a remarkably complex, yet beautifully balanced mix of flavor, texture, and aroma—and all after a single minute in the microwave, or a few minutes submerged in boiling water.Packed inside a convenient, shelf-stable pouch, this creamy, savory, and rich Coconut Chickpea Curry can be enjoyed as a standalone meal for one, with or without a bed of Basmati Rice, or as part of a larger, Indian-inspired spread alongside other favorites like our Tikka Vegetables and Kitchari. We find that with its ease of preparation, and the fact that it can be stored at room temperature, it’s great for keeping on hand for last-minute weeknight dinners, easy weekend lunches, or, if you’re a fan of the great outdoors, toting along on camping trips and backpacking excursions.

title: Chickpea Fusilli Pasta
description: Looking for a high-quality gluten free pasta? Perhaps a pasta with a bit more protein? Or is fiber what you’re favoring these days? Trader Joe’s Chickpea Fusilli Pasta checks all these boxes—and more!Constructed from a blend of chickpeas and tapioca flour, and formed into a classic corkscrew shape, this gluten free Pasta boasts an impressive 11 grams of protein and six grams of fiber per serving—yes! Just as impressive? The Pasta’s toothsome texture makes it an ideal partner to a tangy tomato sauce or creamy alfredo any night of the week, and it’s hearty enough to hold up in a pasta salad with TJ’s French Vinaigrette with Shallots, Marinated Grilled Artichoke Halves, and chunks of Prosciutto Wrapped Fresh Mozzarella Cheese.We’re offering Chickpea Fusilli Pasta in 12-ounce boxes, every day—that’s 50% more pasta than similar boxes found elsewhere, for a mere fraction of the price. In other words, if you’re looking for value—check!

title: Salsa Verde Chicken Enchiladas
description: Our Crew works hard every day so that anyone who walks into their neighborhood Trader Joe’s can say, “This is not your average grocery store!” ‘Not your average’ means we’re committed to providing outstanding value in the form of the best quality products at the best everyday prices. And this approach extends across all the products in our stores, including Trader Joe’s Not Your Average Salsa Verde Chicken Enchiladas.The qualities that make these Enchiladas beyond average are found in every aspect of their construction. Tender, brothy, dark-chicken meat has been shredded and tucked into two corn tortillas in ample quantities. Side-by-side, the Chicken Enchiladas are generously covered with a flavorful Salsa Verde that’s green with tomatillos, poblano chilis, and jalapeño peppers. The final tasty touch is a sprinkling of diced peppers and some melty (once heated) mozzarella. Speaking of heating, about the only thing one could say is average about these Enchiladas is the fact that you conveniently cook them in either a microwave or a conventional oven.

title: Meatless Meatballs
description: Can you have meatballs without meat? Trader Joe’s Meatless Meatballs answer with a resounding (and delicious) yes! So, if it’s not meat, what is it? We’re glad you asked. These Meatless Meatballs are expertly crafted from textured soy protein (TSP)—which is what remains after extracting the oil from soybeans. It’s “textured” because it has the appearance & mouthfeel of meat. It’s “protein” because it naturally contains a notable amount of protein—13g of protein per 4-Meatball serving.Our Meatless Meatballs are alsodelicious, since the TSP is seasoned like the best Italian-style meatballs, using a combination of onions, garlic powder, parsley, basil, sea salt, and black pepper—plus mushroom powder, for an umami-boost. The seasoned soy protein is then formed into couple-bite sized rounds, which are flash frozen so they’re at-the-ready whenever the urge for Meatballs hits. And when itdoeshit, you can quickly heat these kosher, vegan, Meatless morsels using a variety of convenient methods (detailed on the package). In a matter of just 4 to 14 minutes—depending on your approach—you’ll have savory, tender, Meatless Meatballs that complement your pasta, or make a great sandwich stuffer.

title: Japanese Soufflé Cheesecakes
description: Sitting somewhere at the intersection of light & airy and rich & creamy (an intersection that happens to look a whole lot like the freezer case at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s), new Trader Joe’s Japanese Soufflé Cheesecakes present a study in contrasts. Made with sweetened condensed milk and cream cheese, they straddle the line between light-as-air soufflés and moist, toothsome cheesecakes—and oh, what a delicious line it is.Made for us in Japan, where simple, single-serve cakes like these are ubiquitous in cafes and corner stores, TJ’s Soufflé Cheesecakes are an easy, no-mess dessert option for evenings (or afternoons) when being tethered to an oven isn’t on the menu. Simply remove these cute, crustless cakes from their packaging when you get home from work, school, or carpool duty, thaw them for about 3 hours in the refrigerator, and dessert is served! Or, if you’re feeling fancy, top them with a few fresh strawberry slices, a scoop of TJ’s Ube Ice Cream, or a spoonful of TJ’s Mandarin Oranges in Light Syrup and whipped cream.

title: Mobay® Cheese
description: Individually, cheese made from goat’s milk and cheese made from sheep’s milk are fantastic: goat’s milk cheese is typically creamy and elegant, with a soft texture and dry aftertaste, while sheep’s milk cheese is often savory and firm, with a smooth texture and a light nuttiness. But when you put them together, as the talented hands behind Mobay® Cheese have done, that’s something else entirely. Crafted for us by the certified Master Cheesemakers at a renowned Wisconsin creamery, our latest Spotlight Cheese is made by stacking together wheels of flavorful goat’s milk cheese and sheep’s milk cheese, with just a thin layer of faintly smoky grapevine ash between them.Mobay® is a tantalizingly delicious tandem—a showcase for the best aspects of goat’s milk cheese and sheep’s milk cheese, as well as an opportunity to explore how exponentially delicious they taste when eaten together. Best enjoyed in situations where you can truly sit and savor their complex, creamy flavors, try serving Mobay® on crackers or crostini, paired with plenty of dried and fresh fruit. Be sure to try both halves on their own and together—you don’t want to miss out on experiencing the complementary flavor that the grapevine ash brings. And unless you want to miss out on Mobay® entirely, be sure to grab it quick — supplies are limited!

title: Perfect Bar ® Peanut Butter Proten Bar
description: According to his thirteen children, Dr. Bud Keith was a “health food guy” before “health food” was a thing, constantly tinkering with healthy recipes to feed his king-sized family. As the story goes, one day, he ground up a bunch of dried fruits and vegetables, mixed them with freshly ground nut butter and honey, took one bite and declared,“It’s Perfect!”–and with that simple exclamation, Perfect Bars® were born.Perfect Bars® are sweet, moist, and satisfyingly dense, with an irresistible, melt-in-your-mouth texture. The Peanut Butter Perfect Bar® is made primarily of (you guessed it!) peanut butter, which thickens and binds with the addition of organic honey, organic nonfat dry milk, organic dried whole egg, organic rice protein, various organic oils, and a blend of organic whole food powders. The Bars are cold-pressed (not baked) and don’t contain any added preservatives or emulsifiers—and because of this, they should be kept in the refrigerator so their flavor and consistency remain intact. They can last up to one week at room temperature, so you can toss one in your purse, backpack, or workout bag to fuel you for the day ahead!

title: Perfect Bar® Dark Chocolate Chip Peanut Butter Protein Bar
description: According to his thirteen children, Dr. Bud Keith was a “health food guy” before “health food” was a thing, constantly tinkering with healthy recipes to feed his king-sized family. As the story goes, one day, he ground up a bunch of dried fruits and vegetables, mixed them with freshly ground nut butter and honey, took one bite and declared,“It’sPerfect!”–and with that simple exclamation, Perfect Bars® were born.Perfect Bars® are sweet, moist, and satisfyingly dense, with an irresistible, melt-in-your-mouth texture. The Peanut Butter Perfect Bar® is made primarily of (you guessed it!) peanut butter, which thickens and binds with the addition of organic honey, organic nonfat dry milk, organic dried whole egg, organic rice protein, various organic oils, and a blend of organic whole food powders. You’ll also find that each bar is upgraded with a pinch of sea salt and rich, organic dark chocolate chips.Mmmm, chocolate...The Bars are cold-pressed (not baked) and don’t contain any added preservatives or emulsifiers—and because of this, they should be kept in the refrigerator so their flavor and consistency remain intact. They can last up to one week at room temperature, so you can toss one in your purse, backpack, or workout bag to fuel you for the day ahead!

title: Prosciutto Wrapped Fresh Mozzarella Cheese
description: The charcuterie board is always enticing, with its array of sliced meats and cheeses, prepped to be piled on assorted biscuits. As impressive as a board can be, the inventor of “rolloni” really took charcuterie snacking up a notch or two. Trader Joe’s first embraced this rolled charcuterie concept with our holiday Rolloni Meat & Cheese Tray, and we’ve now built on that product’s popularity with an everyday offering that we call Trader Joe’s Prosciutto Wrapped Fresh Mozzarella Cheese.Aside from its obviously charming built-in ‘handle,’ this stick-shaped antipasto boasts some additional charms. For example, the cheese here is Fresh & silky, replacing the firm mozzarella that is most often used in similar rolled charcuterie. Also, that Fresh Mozzarella is Wrapped in imported, eleven-month aged Prosciutto, presenting a rich, flavorful bite.Whether you’re entertaining a crowd, or simply craving quick cheese & charcuterie, our Prosciutto Wrapped Fresh Mozzarella Cheese is a truly handy, no-cracker-required nibble that is sure to please. Deli-icious!

title: Classic Greek Salad
description: The traditional Greek salad is relatively new by ancient historical standards. It was apparently invented in the 1960s when Athenian restauranteurs skirted a tariff on essential salad items by adding non-taxable feta cheese to an already popular plate of cucumber, olives, onion, bell peppers, and tomato. Tourists ate it up. Literally.Now, tourists of the culinary seas (aka our customers) have been eating up Trader Joe’s Classic Greek Salad since 2005—which may not be ancient, but certainly makes this Salad ‘classic’ by our historical standards! And to this day, it remains a tried & true mix of fresh, Greek-inspired ingredients that harken back to the Athenian original.The base of romaine, with green & red cabbages, is complemented by wedges of cucumber, diced red bell pepper, julienned red onion, pitted kalamata olives, and—of course—feta cheese. A red-wine vinaigrette—including dehydrated garlic, and dried herbs (oregano, basil & parsley)—comes in a separate packet, ready to toss with this Salad whenever you’re ready to eat it up.

title: All Occasion Sprinkle
description: If April showers bring May flowers, then what do April sprinkles bring? They bring Trader Joe’s All Occasion Sprinkle, that’s what! A carefully curated blend of classic jimmies, multi-colored “confetti,” and little hearts & flowers, it’s here to add visual appeal and textural interest to all your favorite sweet treats. Whether you’re baking a batch of birthday cupcakes, crafting a decadent dessert for a dinner party, or simply adding a touch of color and whimsy to your morning pancakes, it ups the fun-factor on All Occasions.Unlike other sprinkles on the market, TJ’s All Occasion Sprinkle is made without the use of hydrogenated oils or artificial flavors, and it gets its various, spring-y hues from fruit juice, veggie juice, and spirulina extract. It also comes in a conveniently resealable bag, so you can sprinkle on the magic whenever the mood strikes. (You’ll definitely want to keep it on hand for spontaneous baking adventures and impromptu ice cream sundaes... just saying.)

title: Caesar Salad with Salmon
description: Hail Caesar! This star of the salad world has conquered our hearts in countless variations, and the latest version to join our ready-to-eat ranks may just be the most exciting yet: Trader Joe's Caesar Salad with Salmon! This tasty twist starts by shaking up the classic formula with a base of chopped kale in addition to the customary Romaine, then mixes things up further via the use of crunchy Parmesan cheese crisps instead of croutons. It’s finished with a hearty portion of grilled salmon, which, when mixed all together with the included creamy Romano Caesar dressing, creates a marvelous mix of savory flavors and toothsome textures that all combine into one seriously satisfying salad.Ideal for on-the-go lunches and quick & easy, weeknight dinners, our Caesar Salad with Salmon is ready to eat right out of the fridge, and pairs particularly well with a fruity iced tea. We recommend packing it with some fresh fruit and a Sparkling Peach Black Tea for a complete work lunch or picnic-ready meal.

title:
Gluten Free 
Pizza Dough
description: At Trader Joe’s, we believe that pizza is one of the great unifiers: no matter what your personal tastes, preferences, or diet may be, there’s a pizza out there that will work for you. And to support this belief, we’re committed to making sure that everyone has a chance to discover that pizza—even if you don’t eat gluten. That’s why we’re expanding Trader Joe’s Gluten Free Pizza Dough to be available in all of our stores, from coast to coast. Made with an ingenious mix that includes tapicoa starch, rice flour, and potato starch, this ready-to-bake Dough captures all the same pleasant chewiness of our standard Pizza Dough and Garlic & Herb Pizza Dough, all without containing a single gram of gluten.To enjoy your own homemade gluten free pizza, just let the dough sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes, then rub with olive oil (instead of wheat flour) so you can roll it out to about one-quarter inch thick. Then, top with whatever you like (our Sliced Uncured Pepperoni and Shredded Mozzarella are always great options) and bake at 450°F for 15 to 18 minutes until bubbly and browned. Easy!

title: Jumeokbap
description: You’ve really got to hand it to jumeokbap. From the Korean “jumeok” (fist) and “bap” (rice), food historians estimate that this hearty, handheld dish has likely been a staple of Korean cuisine for thousands of years. Now a rising star in the global street food scene, jumeokbap can be made with any number of fillings and seasonings, and can be enjoyed in all manner of contexts: as a quick, on-the-go bite, as a side with a larger meal, or as a miniature meal all its own. Made for us by a supplier in the Republic of Korea, Trader Joe’s Jumeokbap are flavored with a mix of plant-based bulgogi and savory-seasoned vegetables, and take only about a minute in the microwave to go from frozen to soft, steamy, and ready-to-eat.Traditionally, jumeokbap are spherical, reflecting the shape of a closed fist. Trader Joe’s Jumeokbap are a little more pyramidal, making them a kind of vegan mashup of jumeokbap and Japanese onigiri. We recommend them as a hearty snack when you’re feeling peckish between meals, and we especially recommend serving them with a sauce for dipping. Try pairing a Jumeokbap or two with a bit of our Gyoza Dipping Sauce, or a little mayo mixed with TJ’s Sriracha or Gochujang Paste.

title: Shrimp Scampi
description: Shrimp, garlic, butter, lemon, and white wine. The ingredients to a classic shrimp scampi feel so made for one another, so iconic in their expression of flavor when combined, that it’s somewhat shocking to realize that the dish is only about a century old. In fact, when it was invented in Italy during the 1920s, it was simply known as “scampi,” and featured langoustine lobster, rather than shrimp. As delicious as that certainly was, we’re glad to be living in the era of the modern shrimp scampi we all know and love—an era which now includes the consummately convenient and phenomenally flavorful Trader Joe’s Shrimp Scampi, available in our freezers.Made with a recipe inspired by this staple of Italian-American cuisine, each package is made with shelled, deveined, tail-off shrimp in a rich, flavorful, and enchantingly aromatic sauce made with garlic, butter, white wine, lemon juice, and a bit of grated Romano cheese for an extra touch of umami oomph. It cooks quickly and easily on the stovetop or in the oven, after which it can be served with pasta, rice, crusty bread, or entirely on its own. We like our Shrimp Scampi as a simple, satisfying, no-fuss entrée for a busy weeknight dinner, especially when paired with a side of roasted broccoli, a baked potato, and a crisp and fruity white wine—something like our subtly sparkly Espiral Vinho Verde, for example.

title: Calamari Pieces in Olive Oil
description: In the U.S., calamari conjures up a platter piled with crisp, fried, rings of squid—garnished with lemon wedges and a sauce for dipping. But in Europe, calamari (which simply means “squid” in Italian) refers more generally to squid in a variety of culinary forms. And at Trader Joe’s, Calamari Pieces in Olive Oil refers to an excellent ‘tinned-fish’ value that is simple, convenient, and delicious!In the tin are Humboldt-variety squid (aka ‘Giant Squid’), which are caught off the coast of Spain using the traditional jigging method. Fishers drop lines with multiple lures deep into the ocean and ‘jiggle’ to attract the squid. The large tentacles of the captured Calamari are cleaned & cooked just enough to yield a firm, yet tender texture. They’re cut into 1.5-centimeter chunks and packed with extra virgin olive oil & salt.The mild, slightly briny flavor and tender, meaty texture of Trader Joe’s Calamari Pieces in Olive Oil should win over even the most ‘tin-ative’ tasters; especially when incorporated into a charcuterie board with toasted Organic Baguette slices, Mini Heirloom Tomatoes, Colossal Garlic -Stuffed Olives, and fresh lemon wedges. And these Calamari also score a definite tinned-fish win when added to a bowl of Spanish Rice, or to a batch of prepared Linguine with Pesto & Tomatoes.

title: Everything But The Bartender Classic Lime Margarita
description: While making cocktails at home is certainly fun, nothing quite beats having a skilled bartender make one for you. Which presents us with the exact kind of problem we love to solve: how can you enjoy an expertly crafted mixed drink at home, without being an expert mixologist yourself? How can you have your margarita, and drink it too—so to speak?
